{"kind": "blogger#postList", "nextPageToken": "CgkIChjgit3trSsQy4Ca9ZL8nrwx", "items": [{"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "8303560181443410656", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-27T01:31:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-03-28T02:03:33+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDkwNjQ2ODEzNjE5Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_27.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8303560181443410656", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 28 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 27, BELOW--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_50.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_50.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The new avenues for\ncombating business fraud are:--<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 Beyond Basic Business\nInformation--&nbsp;&nbsp; Companies collect vast\namounts of data about business customers, partners, and suppliers; and today,\nmany new sources of business information are available to enhance insight.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These\nnew sources include: sales and CRM entries, shipment data, labor market data,\nsentiment (or opinion) data, government data, merchant data, utility data,\nsocial media, and other non-traditional data.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After discovering the data\navailable from third party sources \u2013 as well as from across the organization\ninternally \u2013 the next step is to curate the data to derive insights and drive\nsystematic decisions based upon these insights. This process needs to be\nconstantly evaluated and improved, thereby making it virtuous and beneficial at\nreducing business fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 Anticipatory\nAnalytics. With the help of powerful and factual analytics programs, companies\ncan analyze their combined or united data-sets to gain insight into their\nbusiness customers and partners.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Buried within the mounds of data are \u201cred flag\u201d\npatterns or indicators of potential fraud. Anticipatory analytics sift through\nthe noise to uncover fraud signals\u2014that is the likelihood that fraud may\noccur</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014to help companies identify risks and target appropriate actions to\nminimize those risks. Analytics can provide a warning of potential payment\ndelinquency, never paying and first payment default, or ceasing operations by\ncustomers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Companies recognize\nthat they are increasingly vulnerable to this costly fraud threat, but they are\nuncertain how to implement cost-effective controls that can reduce fraud risk\nwithout slowing sales or driving away legitimate customers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scam, hoax,\nmisrepresentation, deception, cheat, sting, swindle, con. These are all terms\nthat apply to fraud. The perpetrators of business fraud typically obtain cash\nand/or goods through normal business transactions but with one important twist:\nThey never intend to pay. Essentially, business fraud is stealing carried out\nthrough carefully planned misrepresentation and deception.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a bust-out fraud\nscenario, the perpetrators create a seemingly legitimate company by using\ntraditional \u201cproofs of right.\u201d&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once established, the fake company applies for\ncredit from multiple vendors, enticing them with the expectation of a mutually\nprofitable business relationship.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fraudsters then\ndraw upon the maximum amount of credit approved by each vendor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a \u201cstraight-roller\u201d\nbust-out fraud, the perpetrators make no attempt to pay. As their invoices go\npast due for 30 days, 60 days, 90 days, and so on, they may offer promises of\npayment or excuses while they complete their scam, but they never pay.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In more\ncomplex bust-out frauds, the perpetrators may pay some or all of the initial\ninvoices in order to negotiate for an even higher credit limit. They will then\n\u201cmax out\u201d their new, more lucrative credit ceiling and then disappear without\npaying.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The enemy in any\nconflict has an equal say in the methods and approach they deploy. Criminals\nare constantly adapting their tactics, seeking new ways to mask their\nactivities, so they can strike and then disappear before their victims catch on\nto their scams. Government and business must be equally adaptive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2013 Anticipatory\nAnalytics Not Only Predicts, But Prevents Fraud. Identifying and preventing\nfraud requires the ability to distill and then transform into insight the\nsubtle signals from multitudes of data. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Companies can take\nadvantage of new technologies and services that cast a light on fraudsters\nhiding in the shadows. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During annual fraud\nforums, members exchange lessons learned and identify emerging trends and best\npractices among corporations and government agencies. They also identify\navailable tools and techniques that reduce the risk of business fraud without\nplacing a burden on legitimate businesses at the point of sale.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no silver\nbullet for eliminating bust-outs and other types of business fraud, but&nbsp; companies can stay ahead of fraudsters\u2019\nchanging tactics and schemes with a multi-layered approach that leverages new\nsources of information, anticipatory analytics, emerging technologies, robust\nemployee training, and collaboration with other public- and private-sector\nstakeholders.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term \"shell\ncompany\" generally refers to limited liability companies, the\nvulnerability of the shell company is greatly compounded when it is privately\nheld and beneficial ownership can more easily be obscured or hidden.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lack of\ntransparency of beneficial ownership can be a desirable characteristic for some\nlegitimate uses of shell companies, but it is also a serious vulnerability that\ncan make some shell companies ideal vehicles for money laundering and other\nillicit financial activity</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anti-corruption/fraud/AML/sanctions\ncompliance program risk assessment.--- Used to assess an organization\u2019s\nprogram\u2014including policies, procedures, training, internal controls and\nmonitoring\u2014an assessment can help determine the level of potential risk\nexposure facing the business. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An effective assessment\nis based on regulatory guidance, as well as leading industry practices and includes\nquantitative and qualitative risk models covering areas such as\nanti-corruption, anti-fraud, AML and sanctions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These models can be integrated\nacross the broader compliance function to provide a holistic view of potential\nrisks inherent in operations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Customer/vendor due\ndiligence. ---Automated programs can be designed to efficiently identify\nshareholders of a potential customer/vendor\u2014including those linked through a\nchain of intermediary companies or directorship\u2014by using global corporate\nregistries and other sources of information. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Should automated\nscreening identify certain customers or vendors, more traditional business\ninvestigative services can be used to help further verify the ultimate\ncorporate structure/beneficial ownership, as well as the potential reputational\nrisks of a relationship. Investigative services can include searches of global\ncorporate records databases, which draw information from a number of key local\ngovernment agencies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transaction monitoring\nand data analytics. ----Systems implemented by institutions are only as good as\nthe analytics that support them, which is why organizations should consider\ncombining human interaction with analytics technology and techniques. This\ncombination can help detect potentially improper transactions\u2014either before the\ntransactions are completed or after they occur. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This process involves\ngathering and storing relevant data and mining it for patterns, discrepancies\nand anomalies, such as payments to offshore jurisdictions, potentially\nrestricted entities or other high-risk entities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Further, non-rules-based\nanalyses can uncover new patterns, trends, fraudulent schemes and scenarios\nthat traditional approaches may miss. Findings from the analyses can be\ntranslated into insights to help manage potential threats before they occur, as\nwell as develop a proactive detection environment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Internal reviews and\ninvestigations. ----If the analysis render findings that should be\ninvestigated, organizations should consider conducting retrospective reviews\nand investigations to help answer the who, what, when, where, how and why\nquestions that give rise to an inquiry\u2014whether self-initiated or as a result of\na regulatory, judicial or law enforcement request. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From an AML/sanctions\nperspective, lookback analyses can include identifying relevant transactions\nthat exhibit potentially suspicious activity, which additionally may help\nmodify and improve ongoing transaction monitoring and management reporting\npractices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">13 percent of\nproperty-casualty insurance industry losses each year are attributable to\nfraud, to the tune of $40 billion.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Coalition Against\nInsurance Fraud is a coalition of insurance organizations, consumers,\ngovernment agencies&nbsp; and legislative bodies\nworking to enact anti-fraud legislation, educate the public, and provide\nanti-fraud advice.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are also a\nresource where consumers can find scam warnings, learn where to report fraud,\nand how to protect themselves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">SOME OF THE THINGS &nbsp;I\nWRITE ARE USA SPECIFIC.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS&nbsp;\nIS TO GREASE THE BRAIN OF INDIAN FRAUD INSPECTORS , &nbsp;THEY NEED TO UNDERSTAND PHOREN JUGAAD TOO. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">ALL THESE THINGS ARE\nGOING ON IN AN INDIAN CONTEXT TOO.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Coalition was\nfounded in 1993 after several organizations reported a heavy rise in insurance\nfraud and a need to stop it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1993, insurance\nfraud investigators staged several bus crashes in New Jersey USA . The only\npassengers in the busses were fraud investigators. After the crash, they\nreceived over 100 claims from people who jumped on the bus after it crashed or\nsimply drove by the scene and wanted to claim insurance money saying they were\ninjured.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In response to this\nproblem, seventeen organizations formed The Coalition Against Insurance Fraud,\ncontributing $500,000 to finance anti-fraud efforts. At the time, The Coalition\nestimated that auto fraud cost over $8 billion a year in overpaid claims.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since then, The\nCoalition has grown to include over 90 members, including GEICO, National\nConsumers League, First Acceptance Corp., Healthcare Insight, Property Casualty\nInsurers Assoc. of America, SAS Institute, Thomson Reuters, Nationwide, and the\nVirginia State Police.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Coalition's main\nmission is to fight insurance fraud. The Coalition seeks to unite and empower\nprivate and public groups against the growing fraud problem. Members work to\ncontrol insurance costs, protect public safety, and \"bring this crime wave\nto its knees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Three main areas of\nactivity are:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Government Affairs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To enact stronger\nanti-fraud laws through local and grassroots campaigns<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Create model bills. For\nexample, establishing insurance fraud as a specific crime.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strengthen anti-fraud\nbills<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hold major summits<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Support prosecutions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Communication<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Raise public awareness\nof insurance fraud, and how public can fight back<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Empower and alert\nconsumers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unite outreach efforts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sponsor major research\nand surveys<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Publications<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Journal of Insurance\nFraud in America (JIFA), a quarterly publication containing in-depth analysis\nof trends, research, and public policy issues that may impact anti-fraud effort<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FraudWire, two\nquarterly digital publications reporting on important developments involving\nlegislative activity and public awareness<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraud News Weekly, a\npaid digital publication summarizing weekly trends on legislative and\nregulatory developments, state and federal court decisions, public outreach and\nmedia coverage, the week's fraud arrests, the latest convictions for insurance\nfraud, civil cases, administrative actions, upcoming meetings, seminars &amp;\nconferences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Get a Grip on Fraud:\nFraud Awareness Manual, an action guide for creating memorable fraud-awareness\nevent</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">The\nCoalition has published several research studies over the past decade. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Among\nthem:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Effectiveness\nof warnings on benefit checks, in 2000, selected insurance companies writing\nworkers compensation coverage in the United States were surveyed to determine\ntheir experience and perceptions with printed warnings on the back of benefit\nchecks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Four\nfaces: why Americans do and don't tolerate fraud, to understand why people\naccept fraud, and why individuals sometimes won't report fraud even though they\nunderstand fraud raises everyone's premiums. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Study\nincludes focus groups and statistical survey. conducted to gain insight on why\npublic tolerance of insurance fraud seems to be increasing. Both qualitative\nand quantitive research was used to attempt to understand how public attitudes\nabout fraud are formed and what factors influence them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Insurer\nfraud measurement, a survey completed by 65 Special Investigative Unit\nmanagers, mostly from property/casualty insurers, on their practices involving\nmeasuring anti-fraud activities for case referrals, fraud savings and\nperformance evaluations of investigators.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Prescription\nfor Peril, examining unreported and elusive aspects of drug diversion, the role\ninsurance fraud pays in financing prescription abuse, and the high cost to\ninsurers and consumers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Special\nInvestigative Unit study, conducted to learn how insurers measure the\nperformance of their Special Investigative Units. A review of the measurement\nsystems of 52 insurers found there is little consistency from insurer to\ninsurer in the methods they use in their performance systems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">State\nInsurance Fraud Bureau Survey, a snapshot of state agencies\u2019 fraud fight by the\nnumbers, aimed at understanding the structure, responsibility, and overall\nactivity of insurance fraud across the United States<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">The\nCoalition issues scam alerts for common schemes, elaborating on variations and\nbest measures for prevention and defense.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Among\nthe topics:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Agents\nand insurers: Though most insurers and agents are honest, the Coalition warns\nagainst agents who pocket their clients' premiums, sell insurance that is fake\nor unnecessary, or provide unneeded coverage to boost premiums.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Auto\nrepairs: Auto repair scams have been known to involve purposely damaging cars\nin order to inflate repair costs, padding existing repairs, or cutting corners\nby doing low-quality work.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Bogus\nhealth plans: A tough economy can make individuals more vulnerable to buying\ntoo-good-to-be-true insurance plans<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Contractors\n&amp; adjusters: The Coalition warns against fraudulent contractors who appear\nafter natural disasters to offer repairs, fraudulent contractors may add damage\nto increase costs, illegally lower deductibles, receive pay and disappear, or\ndo work without a license.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Discount\nmedical cards: these cards offer discounted medical treatment or pills, but\nfake cards may provide no coverage or discounts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Drug\ndiversion. The abuse of prescription drugs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Medical\nidentity theft: Medical identity schemes involve stealing someone's social\nsecurity number, medicare number, medicaid number, and other identifying\ninformation in order to file insurance claims on their behalf for illegal gain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Staged\nauto crashes: The Coalition warns against people who claim nonexistent injuries\nafter crashes in order to exploit their insurance coverage, fraudsters may\npurposely crash into unsuspecting drivers, or stage a crash that is entirely\nset-up in person or on paper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Workers'\ncompensation: The Coalition warns against employers who do not purchase\nadequate coverage for their employees, and employees who fake injuries for paid\ntime off.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">An\ninvestigation led by the Department of Financial Services\u2019 Division of\nInsurance Fraud revealed a large-scale premium fraud scheme in which these six\nindividuals created multiple shell corporations in order to systematically\nconceal payroll amounts for the purposes of obtaining low-cost workers\u2019\ncompensation policies. by grossly deflating accurate payroll amounts, members\nof this fraud network fraudulently secured low cost workers\u2019 compensation\ninsurance policies. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Payroll\namounts were concealed through the use of check cashing stores, which\ncircumvented proper bookkeeping measures. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">After\nsecuring certificates of insurance, organizers would \u2018rent\u2019 the certificates to\nwork crews for a fee. Since the policies were obtained fraudulently, employees\nwere not covered and therefore left vulnerable to high-dollar medical costs in\nthe event of an on-the-job injury. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">To\nfurther their scheme, organizers would print and provide fake business cards to\nthese work crews, who were instructed to present them to workers\u2019 compensation\ncompliance investigators who routinely conduct compliance checks at job sites\nto ensure proper coverage is in place.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">This\ncycle of fraud would continue until an insurance policy expired or was\ncancelled, at which time organizers would open another shell company under a\ndifferent name and begin the process again. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Shell\ncompanies are owned by straw owners, or individuals who, for a fee, agree to\nserve as the legal owner of a business because they have a clean criminal\nrecord. These businesses, however, were alternatively run by organizers who\ndirected the day-to-day activities and operations of the illegal activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Fraud\naudits are a blend of new methodologies and traditional audit tools. Within a\ncompany's accounts payable file, shell companies are being used to steal\nmillions of dollars from companies or to conceal bribery payments which violate\nanti-bribery and corruption laws. A shell corporation is a legally created\nentity that has no active business or an entity used to conceal the true\nidentity of the real company operating through a shell company. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">In\nessence, a shell corporation exists mainly on paper, has no physical presence,\nemploys no one, and produces nothing. Within more sophisticated concealment\nstrategies the perpetrators may employ the use of an office or employees to\nprovide the illusion of a legitimate business entity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Shell\ncorporations are frequently used to shield identities or to hide money in cases\nof money laundering, bankruptcy, bribery, and fraudulent conveyances. Scandals\nrange from thousands to millions of dollars and always result in embarrassing\nmoments for the company and management. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Fraud\nconcealment involves the strategies used by the perpetrator of the fraud\nscenario to conceal the true intent of the transaction. Common concealment\nstrategies are: false documents, false representations, false approvals, avoiding\nor circumventing control levels, internal control inhibitors, blocking the\naccess to information, geographic distance between documents and controls, and\nboth real and perceived pressure. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">An\nimportant aspect of fraud concealment pertains to the level of sophistication\nused by the perpetrator. Inherent fraud schemes aren't thought of in terms of\ncomplexity; rather it is the level of sophistication used to conceal the fraud\nscenario that is the focus for the fraud auditor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">&nbsp;On its most simplistic level, without a\nconcealment strategy, the inherent fraud scheme would be visible. Fraud\nconcealment sophistication should be rated on both the perpetrator's ability to\nhide the transaction and the auditor's ability to detect the transaction. To\naid in the determination of the sophistication of the concealment strategy\nlevel, we use a rating scale of low, medium, and high.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">There\nis a correlation between fraud detection and the sophistication of the\nconcealment strategy. When the perpetrator's concealment strategy is more\nsophisticated than the audit methodology, the fraud goes undetected. Therefore,\nfraud is revealed when the audit detection is more sophisticated than the\nconcealment strategy. The key is to identify what are commonly referred to as\nred flags of the concealment strategy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">There\nare four categories of red flags: data, documents, internal controls, and\nbehavior. The categories are intended to aid the auditor in identifying the red\nflags in an orderly fashion, whereby, the auditor should not view the process\nas a right or wrong exercise, but instead know that certain items can occur in\nmultiple categories.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">The\nprocess of detecting shell corporations is a two-step process. The first step\nis to conduct fraud data analytics interrogation routines, which are designed\nto locate vendors that are consistent with the data profile of a shell\ncorporation or transactions that are indicative of a shell corporation. The\nsecond step is to perform audit procedures which are designed to pierce the\nconcealment strategy or reveal the truth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">The\ndata mining strategy is a two-fold process. The first step is to build the data\nprofile for the fraud scenario. The second step is to understand how the\nsophistication of the concealment strategy impacts the fraud data analytics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Shell\ncompanies often times have non descriptive names. One search is to look for\nnames with a limited number of constants in the name. Obviously, the country or\nlanguage the search is performed in will impact the variable. Shell\ncorporations often use mobile lines when no physical office exists. Also\nsearching for pass-through fraud schemes, duplicate telephone number search is\nan effective tool, when the pass-through is associated with an existing\nsupplier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Search\nfor a correlation between first invoice date and the creation date. Payments\nare transferred either by wire or address. The routing number can be used to\ncorrelate to prospective individuals. The theory is simple; the perpetrator is\nsmart enough not to use their personal bank account but would use the same bank\nfor their shell corporation bank account.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Insurance\ncompanies have always relied on technology to fight fraud. The III reports that\n95 percent of insurers say they use antifraud technology, but about half say a\nlack of information technology resources prevents them from fully implementing\nit. The invoice number pattern is one the most critical data fields for our\nfraud data analytics. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">The\nreason is simple, the perpetrator creates the number. The pattern and frequency\nanalysis is critical for the search for false billing schemes. The\nlow-sophistication scheme will most likely have a sequential pattern of invoice\nnumbers. For the pass-through scheme, the invoice number pattern will depend on\nwhether the pass-through entity has one or a few customers.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Compare\nto date of payment to the invoice date using a speed of payment analysis.&nbsp;&nbsp; Look for vendors where all amounts are below\na threshold requiring two approvals. Google Maps: Online maps can determine\nwhat physical structure is located at the known address and whether the address\nis consistent with the entity structure. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Often,\nthe created entity scheme will use the address of a personal residence.\nRemember that many small businesses operate from the owner's personal\nresidence, so, in this case, reference checking may be preferred in order to\nreveal that the entity does not conduct business. Real companies tend to have\ninsurance.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">The\nfraud testing procedure would consist of a request of the certificate of\ninsurance. Fortunately, such a request is a normal control procedure in many\ncompanies, but for fraud audit purposes, the need is to examine the certificate\nto take note the date of coverage and types of coverage. Shipping documents:\nDocuments such as, a billing of lading indicates the source of the shipment,\ntherefore providing verification.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today 60% of insurance\ncompanies are using predictive analytics to address fraud potential. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A bleed-out is most\noften an inside job, where corporate managers, directors, or officers emaciate\na company's value through insider asset transfers.&nbsp; The company is not necessarily established\nfor the purpose of carrying out a bleed-out, and may not even be in financial\ndistress.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, like any\ncompany, its vulnerability is exposed when collusive insiders have control and\nsubordinate the company's success to their personal gain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Commonly, an insider,\nor group of insiders, enter into transactions on behalf of the company with the\npurpose of redirecting a business asset in favor of the insider and to the\nprejudice of the company.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, money\ncould be thrown at a fledgling subsidiary that happens to be controlled by an\nofficer who also serves as an officer for the company being depleted.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Often these\ntransactions are document-intensive, well-planned, and hidden to reduce the\nrisk of exposure.&nbsp; In other words, simply\nlooking at the statements and schedules will not typically reveal a bleed-out\nscheme.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">WHY IS \u201cBABE IN THE WOODS\u201d &nbsp;PM MODI UNABLE TO EXTRADITE &nbsp;LALIT MODI AND VIJAYA MALLYA FROM BRITAIN ?<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">WE KNOW WHY!<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">WHEN THEY COME BACK A \u201c</span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">CAN OF WORMS</span><span style=\"background-color: white;\">\u201d WILL BE OPENED OUT<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS WONT SUIT A FEW BIG FISH BJP POLITICIANS AND THEIR FOREIGN\nALLIES !<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2671122416512890538\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_9M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_27.html?showComment=1490591385047#c2107932219066161905\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 27, 2017 at 10:39 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_8MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nLET ME QUOTE WIKI-<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE --In 2008, the movement claimed to have more than 825,000 regular students, with over 8,500 centers in 100 countries...The Brahma Kumaris at the United Nations is an international non-governmental organisation (NGO) in general consultative status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations.[65] and UNICEF. UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">WHO CAN OPEN 100 CENTRES WORLDWIDE FOR YOU ?&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\nSame way Sri Sri Ravishankar who wrote that Vedas contain \" nothing against homosexuality \" is working in special consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) of the United Nations.<br />\n<br />\nIn 2010, Art of Living sued two bloggers, \"Skywalker\" and \"Klim\", accusing them of defamation, trade libel, copyright infringement and disclosing trade secrets.<br />\n<br />\nWHAT IS HIS DEADLY SECRET ?<br />\n<br />\nWHY DOES A GURU NEED TO SUE IN COURT ?<br />\n<br />\nwhy did Modi give sri sri Ravishankar a PADMA VIBHUSHAN ?<br />\n<br />\nHis book Ashtavakra Gita is all bullshit !<br />\n<br />\nAs soon as I wrote on Yazidis he went running there to grab credit. I was the first person on the planet to reveal that Yazidis are Hindus and their Mecca is Palani temple in ancient Cherala Empire -- today in Tamil Nadu ( made by Calicut King Cheraman Perumal )<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/the-yazidis-of-iraq-ethnic-cleansing-by.html</span><br />\n<br />\nCAN THIS FELLOW SRI SRI RAVISHANKAR EVEN UNDERSTAND WHAT I WROTE BELOW ?<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/extracorporeal-membrane-oxygenation.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMIND YOU--I HAVE KEPT THE TWO POSTS ABOVE AT LAYMANs LEVEL<br />\n<br />\nand what is SADGURU JAGGI VASUDEV doing in UN and International FREEMASON seminars ?<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">SANATANA DHARMA NEITHER SUPPORTS BRAHMACHARIS OR BRAHMA KUMARIS .</span></b><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_9b+seedUAKYD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_9b+seedUAKYD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nearly 85 % of all\nbankruptcy fraud of BIG FISH ( not startups ) &nbsp;involves the concealment of assets. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Creditors can only liquidate those assets\nlisted by the debtor; thus, if the debtor fails to reveal certain assets, the\ndebtor can keep the assets despite having an outstanding debt.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To further conceal the assets, businesses or\nindividuals may transfer these unrevealed assets to friends, relatives, or an\nassociate so that the asset cannot be located.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This type of fraud raises the risk and costs associated with lending and\nbecomes passed on to others who wish to borrow money.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Petition mills are one\ntype of bankruptcy fraud scheme on the rise in the United States. Petition\nmills purport to keep financially-strapped tenants from becoming evicted by\npassing themselves off as a consulting service.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the tenant believes to be\nreceiving help in avoiding eviction, the petition mill actually files the\ntenant for bankruptcy and drags out the case. Meanwhile, the \u201cservice\u201d charges\nexorbitant fees, empties the tenant\u2019s savings account, and ruins the tenant\u2019s\ncredit score.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Multiple filing fraud consists\nof filing for bankruptcy in multiple states, using the same name and\ninformation, using aliases and fake information, or some combination thereof.\nMultiple filings slow down the court systems\u2019 ability to process a bankruptcy\nfiling and liquidate the assets. Often, multiple filings provide more cover for\na debtor trying to engage in the concealment of assets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When people or\norganizations have more debts than they can manage, they sometimes file for\nbankruptcy in a federal bankruptcy court. When you file for bankruptcy, your\ncreditors can no longer on their own try to sue you or collect your property to\nsatisfy unpaid debts.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Instead, your creditors must go to the bankruptcy court\nin which you've filed your bankruptcy petition, where the judge will determine\nhow much property you have, how much you owe, and who gets repaid. The process\nis designed to allow debtors a new start by getting out from under crushing debts.\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When BIG FISH do this, it is invariably\na FRAUD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Limited liability\ncompanies first became widely available in the U.S. in the early 1990s. The\nGerman version (GmbH, or Gesellschaft mit beschr\u00e4nkter Haftung) has been in\nexistence since the late 1800s thanks to JEW R.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LLC is a hybrid form of\nbusiness entity that can protect the owners effectively in the case of legal\naction. Like a corporation the LLC structure removes the members and managers\nfrom liability, and, like a partnership, it provides certain tax benefits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is considered a\n\u201cpass-through\u201d arrangement because the individuals are taxed rather than the\ncompany (unless the company elects to be taxed as a corporation.).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; An LLC is easier to set up than a\ncorporation and LLCs are subject to relatively few procedural requirements\nrelating to the governance of the business entity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An LLC makes an\nattractive vehicle for a shell company. Some LLCs can be owned or managed\nanonymously, and are therefore inherently vulnerable to abuse. Virtually anyone\ncan own or manage an LLC, including foreign persons and other business\nentities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A member of an LLC is equivalent to a shareholder in a corporation. A\nmanager, on the other hand, is equivalent to an executive officer or a member\nof the board of directors. An LLC may lack managers, in which case the members\nwould manage the LLC. Some states in USA do not require the names or addresses\nof members or managers. In some cases, only the names of managers and not members\n(owners) are reported.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;A foreign LLC must file with the state in\norder to \u201cdo business\u201d in that state. It is important to understand that\ncompanies owned by out-of-state or foreign persons or entities are formed as\ndomestic LLCs unless they were originally formed in another jurisdiction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, newly\ncreated shell companies owned by such persons or entities will often fall into\nthe domestic classification.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are additional\nways to further obscure ownership and activity. For example, because an LLC can\nbe owned or managed by one or more other business entities \u2013 a corporation, a\nlimited partnership, a general partnership, a trust, or even another LLC \u2013\nlayers of ownership can be devised which make it highly unlikely that relations\nbetween various individuals and companies can be discerned, even if one or more\nof the beneficial owners are actually known or discovered. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In Delaware and other states, an LLC serving\nas a member or manager for another LLC is not considered to be \u201cdoing business\u201d\nin the state solely by reason of being a member or manager of the other LLC. The\naddress \"1209 North Orange Street\" in Wilmington, Del., has become\nknown in recent years as the epicenter of U.S. corporate secrecy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The squat,\nsplit-level building is the official address of over 285,000 companies, many of\nwhich are looking to take advantage of Delaware\u2019s Panama-like secrecy rules,\ntax incentives, and business-friendly case law.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hillary and Bill Clinton\nquietly set up two shell companies listed at \"1209 North Orange\nStreet\" in 2008 and 2013.. one of the Clintons\u2019 \"1209 North Orange\nStreet\" companies is WJC, LLC, which was set up by Bill Clinton in 2008 as\na pass-through for his consulting fees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another company at the\nsame location, ZFS Holdings, LLC, was set up in February 2013, one week after\nHillary Clinton left the State Department. Hillary Clinton received $5.5\nmillion from her book publisher, Simon &amp; Schuster, through the company.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The \"1209 North\nOrange Street\" building is the headquarters for the Corporation Trust\nCompany. The firm acts as a registered agent for thousands of corporations that\nare not actually located in Delaware, including the Clintons\u2019 companies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anti-secrecy advocates\nsay the building is prime evidence that Delaware has become a corporate haven\nthat\u2019s comparable to more well-known, offshore locales.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you imagined a\nbuilding with 1,000 corporations in it, you\u2019d imagine a building like the\nEmpire State building--but 285,000 companies claim [1209 North Orange Street]\nis their address.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An LLC serving as member\nor manager of another LLC could organize in a state offering the least\ntransparency and conduct activities in a number of other states without reporting\nthe identities of members or managers.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An additional benefit\nthat applies equally to LLCs (or corporations) formed in any state is the air\nof legitimacy afforded foreign owners in operating a U.S.-based company.\nFurther legitimacy may possibly be obtained by organizing in a state without an\ninternational reputation for privacy of ownership.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; It will be like trading shares on Wall Street.<br />\n<br />\nSOON WE WOULD HAVE BEEN TRADING HUMAN FARTS WITH BEEF EATERS FARTING THE LEAST<br />\n<br />\nVan Jones sits on the board of ShoreBank and is one the marketing directors for \"green\" projects. Yes, the same college that Hillary Clinton and Jan Piercy, a co-founder of Shorebank attended.<br />\n<br />\nSUCH A NICE CIRCLE OF JEWS<br />\n<br />\nIt was estimated that over 10 TRILLION dollars each year will be traded on the CXX exchange.<br />\n<br />\nAt a commission rate of only 4 percent, the exchange would earn close to 400 billion dollars to split between its owners, all Obama cronies. Of course, Obama's \"commissions\" would be held in trust for him at the Joyce Foundation.<br />\n<br />\nThis would have been the largest \"scam\" or \"legal heist\" in world history.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>HULLO ALICE IN WONDERLAND APCO MODI<br /><br />GUJJU DIMAAG MEIN KUCH GHUSA ?&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\nDHOKLA AUR SHRIKAND KHAO.<br />\n<br />\nSHAYAD KUCH FARAK PADENGA..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_76b+seedD0kMD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_76b+seedD0kMD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">LEELA OF JEWS &nbsp;!</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/15183346.Scots_shell_companies_used_to_launder___4_billion_out_of_Russia/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/15183346.Scots_shell_companies_used_to_launder___4_billion_out_of_Russia/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When someone who has\nfiled for bankruptcy or any other person conceals assets, makes false\nstatements under penalty of perjury (orally or in writing), files a false\nclaim, destroys or conceals financial records relevant to the case, or gives or\ntakes a bribe, that person has committed criminal bankruptcy fraud, a federal\ncrime.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bankruptcy fraud can\nalso occur when a debtor attempts to bribe a creditor. Creditors are not\nrequired to file a claim against the debtor after the debtor files for\nbankruptcy. The debtor might, for example, try to convince a creditor not to\nfile a claim by offering a cash payment if the creditor agrees not to file a\nclaim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trustees, attorneys, or\nother officers of the court embezzle funds that are part of the bankruptcy\nestate. These acts are also considered bankruptcy fraud. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Red Flags/Common\nCharacteristics&nbsp; of bankruptcy fraud----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Company with a short\nlife<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Well-established\ncompany with good credit recently taken over by a new group trying to hide the\nchange in ownership<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Fraudulent financial\nstatements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 False credit\nreferences<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 No receivables listed\non schedules (cash basis operation)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Inventory scheduled\nis very low<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Warehouse full of\nhigh-volume, low-cost items<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
