Other reasons\nfor such \u201cloafing\u201d may include the \u201cwhy bother\u201d feelings that stem from group\ndomination, the absence of compelling incentives to actively participate in the\ndiscussion and an individual\u2019s failure to make a sufficient personal investment\nin the group\u2019s task.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It may be that members of the engagement team are juggling\nnumerous client engagements or some team members may be working on a specific\naspect of the engagement, such as IT or tax specialty work and thus may \u201ccheck\nout\u201d when the discussion does not directly address their specific aspect of the\nengagement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN YOU KEEP QUIET\nNOBODY CAN FIND OUT IF YOU ARE A SAGE OR A DUFFER<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fear of losing\ncredibility also may prevent individuals from participating. If individuals\nfeel they need to protect their standing, they will be less likely to voice an\nunpopular idea or opinion. This may be a problem for less experienced audit\nstaff members or others recently assigned to the client engagement.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They may\nfeel unqualified to speak openly about engagement-specific risks or be\nreluctant to do so in front of more experienced engagement team members, who\neventually will play a role in their performance evaluations. Such\nself-censuring behavior can hinder a group\u2019s ability to handle the complex\nnature of the fraud-risk-assessment process\u2014the very type of problem for which\n\u201coutside the box\u201d thinking is critical.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groupthink is another\npitfall to avoid. This phenomenon occurs when team members become so concerned\nwith reaching consensus that they fail to realistically evaluate all ideas or\nsuggestions. Audit teams can be particularly susceptible to this as auditors generally\nare very sensitive to time/budget pressures.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, they quickly may align with\nthe group\u2019s view of fraud risks in an effort to complete the task efficiently.\nAlso, because the brainstorming requirement is new, there may be a lack of \u201cbuy\nin\u201d that prompts team members to embrace the group\u2019s views quickly in order to\nmove to other tasks perceived as being more critical.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groupshift is the\nfourth pitfall. While a purpose of brainstorming sessions is to help the audit\nteam collectively arrive at conclusions about fraud risks, team leaders must\nexercise caution to avoid allowing the team to take an extreme position on\nfraud risk.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, a group whose members generally are conservative might\nshift toward a more conservative position while a group of risk-takers might\nlean toward even riskier positions. With the recent emphasis on fraud\ndetection, there is some cause for concern audit teams will assume the risks\nare high in all engagements.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The leader should\nestablish a strong foundation for brainstorming sessions by communicating\nfundamental ground rules before a session begins: Do not criticize others\u2019\nideas, let each person speak, and try to build on others\u2019 ideas. Audit team\nmembers should know what to expect of themselves and others.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is particularly\nimportant that all participants feel their input is valued and their voice will\nbe heard. The leader also should make certain that participants understand how\nthe session will proceed and how ideas generated during the meeting will impact\nthe audit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;At the beginning of a meeting, the leader\nshould genuinely encourage all audit team members, including less experienced\nstaff, to express any idea no matter how unusual it may seem.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because not\neveryone enters the brainstorming activity with a similar level of knowledge or\nexperience with the client or willingness to share ideas about fraud risk in an\nopen-ended fashion, it is important to establish a comfortable environment.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no substitute for having the engagement leader stress to the audit\nteam the importance of the brainstorming session, emphasizing that every idea\nis valued and everyone has something to contribute to the discussion.\nDemonstrated genuine involvement by the engagement leader will go a long way\ntowards setting the stage for all team members to engage in the activity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Take a \u201czero tolerance\u201d\nstance on criticism. The leader must make it clear that no criticism about any\nissue presented will be allowed while the group is generating ideas about fraud\nrisks. Imagine the reaction of a new staff person whose manager laughs or rolls\nher eyes at that individual\u2019s suggestion. Any perception of criticism can\nquickly shut down a team member\u2019s willingness to participate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Criticism also\nmay negatively affect the efficiency of the brainstorming activity by diverting\nattention from the risk assessment process to other subjects. With a \u201czero\ntolerance for criticism\u201d expectation, the team is less likely to fall prey to\nthe pitfalls noted. Open-mindedness, not conformity, should be the meeting\u2019s\ngoal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Participants should\nmake every effort to generate as many ideas as possible about how and where the\nentity may be susceptible to fraud and how management might conceal its\nactions. The greater the number of ideas about potential fraud risks, the more\nlikely the group will accurately identify and assess relevant fraud risks and\ndevelop appropriate audit responses to them.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If idea generation about fraud\nrisks within a particular business process (for example, inventory management)\nor account (investments) begins to wane, the leader should shift the discussion\nto another business process (purchasing) or account (receivables) or rephrase\nthe current question to get the group thinking differently.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, if the group is\ndiscussing how receiving personnel might steal inventory and the brainstorming\nprocess begins to slow, the session leader might ask participants to think\nabout how purchasing personnel could misappropriate inventory (for example,\nredirecting inventory orders to unauthorized locations). Reframing issues from\ndifferent perspectives can be a valuable technique for increasing the number of\nideas generated about a particular fraud risk.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is important for the\nleader to assign credit for ideas generated to the group as a whole rather than\nto a contributing member. Recognizing group ownership of ideas is more likely\nto increase the team\u2019s interest and its commitment to its goals than when\nindividuals are rewarded personally.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">IN SHIPBOARD\nBRAINSTORMING SESSIONS I DO NOT ALLOW NAMES TO BE TAKEN.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">ANY VICTIMIZATION AFTER A BRAINSTORMING\nSESSION , IS DEALT WITH SEVERELY</span></b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ultimately, the\ninformation gathered during the brainstorming session should be combined with\nthat obtained through other planning activities to identify the risks of\nmaterial misstatements due to fraud. Thus, before leaving the brainstorming\nsession, team members need to clarify, refine and achieve consensus on\nconclusions about initial fraud risk ideas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some firms have the\nteam classify fraud risks in one of two categories: risks affecting the overall\nengagement and risks affecting a specific account or class of transactions.\nOther methods of summarizing fraud risks involve classifying them along the\nthree conditions of the fraud triangle of incentive/pressure , opportunity ,\nand rationalization/attitude .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By grouping ideas related to these three\nconcepts, the team will be focusing on conditions that ultimately may indicate\nhigh fraud risk. That is, the team may be more likely to identify areas in\nwhich incentives are excessive and opportunities exist for individuals whose\nattitudes enable them to rationalize fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The engagement leader\nshould assign someone responsibility for documenting the results of this discussion\nand any necessary follow-up procedures.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, if the audit team believes\nthere is an increased risk of fraud related to the client\u2019s revenue\nrecognition, it will document that additional targeted procedures will be\nperformed, which might include specific analytical procedures for revenue\naccounts by product line, inquiries of sales and operations personnel about\nside agreements, or specific revenue cut-off procedures at year-end.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The risks identified\nand the related responses must be documented in the audit files along with\ninformation about how and when the brainstorming discussion occurred, the audit\nteam members who participated and the subject matter discussed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Participants are more\nlikely to generate high-quality ideas if they know what is expected of them and\nunderstand the rules of the activity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While certain aspects\nof the team\u2019s planned audit responses will be evident to management, the\nsession leader should emphasize to team members that there is a need to avoid\ndisclosing information about such responses to preserve the confidentiality of\nthe auditor\u2019s procedures. For example, a surprise inventory count would lose\nmuch of its value if management were to know in advance of its timing and\nlocation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A brainstorming session\nis held during planning to identify fraud risks and develop procedures to\naddress them. Then, during the wrap-up phase of the audit, a fraud checklist is\ncompleted to ensure no risks were overlooked and that appropriate procedures\nwere performed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of course, the loop is not complete unless everyone on the\naudit team is aware of the brainstorming session and its outcome. So, be sure\nto provide the results of the session to any team members who do not attend the\nsession. Written memos can be circulated among team members or links to\nelectronic audit files can provide easy sharing of key fraud risk information\namong engagement team personnel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2013, US federal\nauthorities shut down a massive synthetic ID fraud scheme that created 7,000 false\nidentities to obtain more than 25,000 credit cards that resulted in more than\n$200 million in confirmed losses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The scheme involved a\nthree-step process that included:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--Fabricating synthetic\nidentities by creating fraudulent identification&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">documents and credit\nprofiles</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--Boosting the credit\nof the synthetic identities by providing false&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">creditworthiness\ninformation</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--Running up large\nloans using the false identity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To remain undetected,\nthe fraudsters maintained more than 1,800 \u201cdrop addresses,\u201d including houses,\napartments and Post Office boxes, which were used as the mailing addresses of\nthe false identities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They also created\ndozens of sham SHELL companies that did little or no legitimate business,\nobtained credit card terminals for the companies, and then ran up charges on\nthe fraudulent credit cards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To support the scheme,\nthe fraudsters reportedly spent millions of dollars sustaining the elaborate\nnetwork of drop addresses and running credit reports on the thousands of false\nidentities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal was \u201cto get\ncredit cards, get the credit limits as high as possible, then use those credit\nlimits to max them out, and then walk away.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nA lot of what they did was very painstaking and very sophisticated and\ntook a long time.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fortunately, robust and\nreliable countermeasures to synthetic ID fraud are available to organizations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/eEnX_TzmuSk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/eEnX_TzmuSk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://www.equifax.com/technology/anakam/products/en_tas\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.equifax.com/technology/anakam/products/en_tas</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The prevalence of\nsynthetic identity theft has increased by more than 150 percent since\n2010.&nbsp;&nbsp; 3 % of the U.S. population, or\nabout 7 million identities, are \"synthetic.\"</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic identity\ntheft has been made easier thanks to changes by the US Social Security\nAdministration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the past, the first\nthree digits of a Social Security number denoted the geographic area of USA\nwhere you lived when the card was issued.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nSince 2011, the numbers have been randomly generated, making it harder\nto tell if they are valid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Watch for mail that\ncomes to you, but has someone else's name on it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You also should keep an\neye on your bank and credit card statements and verify all the transactions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic identity\ntheft is the crime of committing identity fraud while using fictitious\ninformation. This means that some or all of the information behind the identity\nis false. Identity thieves often take real Social Security Numbers and pair\nthem with fake information.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ways to go about\nobtaining personal identifying information are obvious. Some examples include\nstealing mail, trash, phishing or hacking online accounts, and taking advantage\nof workplace authority. Regardless, the point is that the thief gets their\nhands on sensitive pieces of information.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They then look for weaknesses within\nthe data, such as by checking their credit report.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The smartest identity\nthieves up their profits further by paying off the debts with fraudulent\nchecks. Doing this allows the cards to get used up a second time, therefore\ndoubling the amount the criminal pockets from the crime. And, it\u2019s unfortunate\nbut, a lot of the time it\u2019s \u201ccredit repair experts\u201d trying to help people build\ntheir credit without realizing scammers are taking advantage of them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Creating fictitious\nreports on synthetic credit files---&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This is the most\nadvanced method of synthetic identity theft that exists. To pull it off, the\ncriminal needs access to a company that can report to the credit bureaus.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Organized identity crime groups have the ability to pull strings and partner up\nwith small business owners to make this possible. Also, some owners and\nemployees learn how it\u2019s done and take advantage of their reporting privileges\non their own.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, the company will\nset up a credit account in the fictitious identity and then send positive\nreports to the credit bureaus. The person running the scheme has the choice to\nuse the business credit accounts as a way to open the credit file, or to build\nup one that\u2019s already open.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The latter works best as it allows the company to\nget away with a higher credit limit overall. It also gives the fraudster the\npower to increase the account\u2019s limit at a faster rate than normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now, the thief can run\nthis scheme with one of two end games. First, they can defraud the company\nsupporting the scam and await compensation from insurance payouts. Second, they\ncan use the strong credit history they created to get a bunch of credit lines\nelsewhere to max out.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The only problem is that they cannot run this fraud under\na bunch of names, or for amounts much greater than the business\u2019s product\nvalues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regardless, the scam\noften ends within the same year it starts and there\u2019s a good chance the two end\ngames will cross paths. This is because, in the case of a real business\nsupporting the crime, the suspect will have to show criminal activity on the\nbusiness\u2019s account. Failing to do so would raise a lot of suspicion and point\nthe police right to the culprit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the digital age,\nobtaining verifiable data to create a synthetic ID and nurture it is becoming\nincreasingly easy in USA. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">INDIA IS NOT YET FULLY\nDIGITALISED. &nbsp; &nbsp;WE NEED TO KNOW THE\nPITFALLS</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Since real people won\u2019t see activity on an\naccount created with their SSN that doesn\u2019t include their exact name or\naddress, they\u2019re not going to raise any red flags. And when unusual activity\ndoes occur on the fake account, the synthetic-identity fraudster will promptly\nconfirm that the suspicious activity is \u201clegitimate\u201d if contacted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraudsters have\nrelatively easy access to personally identifiable information to create\nsynthetic ID facilities. Data breaches, often massive, are a primary source. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The building blocks of\na synthetic ID can include personally identifiable information (PII), but the\nopportunities for fraud that Social Security numbers (SSNs) provide make them\nhighly valuable for fraudsters.&nbsp;&nbsp; More\nthan 70% of top financial institutions allow the use of SSNs as identifiers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, breaches\nat two major health insurance companies exposed SSNs, birth dates and other\naccount data of more than a combined 93 million subscribers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To avoid possible\ndetection, fraudsters often seek out SSN of people who don\u2019t make use of\ncredit. The elderly are targeted, especially those living with relatives who\nare less likely to use credit cards or pay utility bills. Children are targets,\ntoo, primarily because parents are extremely unlikely to check their credit\nreports, which limits fraud detection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Proprietary algorithms\nin robust solutions are especially useful in identifying synthetic IDs. By\ncomparing an SSN to a consumer\u2019s unique identification information, the\nalgorithm determines how well a consumer\u2019s SSNs matches its identity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most useful tools\nreturn both positive confirmations of an SSN match and several negative alerts\nthat can signal the creation of a synthetic identity or other SSN-related fraud\nat account opening \u2014 before any damage is done.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warnings to look for:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--SSN can\u2019t be matched\nto the specific consumer based on comparison algorithms<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- SSN matches to a\ndifferent consumer, while no credit file is available for the requested\napplicant<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- SSN matches to\ndifferent consumer, and a credit file is available for the name and address\nprovided; however, the SSN on that file is different from the SSN provided on\nthe inquiry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><b>BEFORE INDIA GOES INTO DIGITIZATION&nbsp;WE MUST KNOW THE WORKINGS</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today, synthetic ID\nfraud accounts for 80% of all credit card fraud losses, and nearly \u00bc th of\ncredit card charge-offs in USA. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rise in synthetic\nID fraud can be attributed to a variety of conditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First, it\u2019s not\nespecially difficult to create a synthetic ID. The steps include:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--Obtain an SSN of\nanother person<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--Fabricate a name to\nbe used with the SSN<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--Create false birth\ndates that tend to match the appearance of the fraudster in case any in-person\nappearances are required<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--Create an address to\nreceive mail fraudulently<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- Provide telephone\nnumbers that will probably be untraceable or stale by&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">the time the fraud is\nrealized</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the identities are\ncreated, fraudsters typically nurture them until they mature. They open\naccounts at different organizations, check their credit scores regularly, and\nchoose the perfect time to exploit the accounts to the maximum degree possible.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the aftermath,\nfinancial-services organizations are generally left with a significant loss and\nnobody to chase in their collection and recovery process.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historically, synthetic\nID fraud was generally committed by consumers whose poor credit ratings made it\ndifficult to open credit card accounts or receive loans. With a few adjustments\nto their personally identifiable information, cash-strapped consumers were able\nto create new accounts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic ID fraud is\nbuilt on the foundation of a fictitious identity, often created with a\ncombination of real data and fabricated information. For example, the fraudster\nmay \u201cborrow\u201d one person\u2019s Social Security number (SSN), combine it with another\nperson\u2019s name, and use someone else\u2019s address to create a brand new identity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The perpetrator can\nthen use this fraudulent identity to apply for credit, make major purchases, or\na variety of other activities that give the identity a financial history.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic ID fraud has\nsince transitioned into a widely used criminal activity designed to steal many millions\nof dollars. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, in 2013\nthe U.S.Attorney\u2019s Office for the District of New Jersey charged 18 defendants\nwith plotting a $200 million credit card fraud conspiracy that involved\nfabricating more than 7,000 identities to obtain tens of thousands of credit\ncards<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In typical identity\ntheft, a fraudster pretends to be a victim by using that person's real name,\nSocial Security number and other personal information. The criminal doesn't\nchange any of that pilfered data.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But in synthetic\nidentity theft, a criminal essentially creates a whole new identity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This kind of identity\nthief starts with a real Social Security number, but then adds fake\ncredentials, such as a fake name, address, birth date and so on. It's a\nFrankenstein's monster, stitched together from various parts into something\nthat looks approximately like a real person.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bad guys then use these\nmanufactured identities to apply for jobs and build credit little by little,\nfor example by obtaining cellphone service or credit cards \u2014 small accounts\nthat, properly maintained, can establish enough credit to obtain larger loans that\nwon't be paid back.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since such a criminal\nonly uses some of a consumer's personal information, the fraud often won't show\nup on the legitimate SSN holder's credit report. On the other hand, negative\ninformation attached to another file can be linked to the individual's file in\nthe credit bureau, negatively affecting his or her credit report and credit\nscore<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since this type of ID\ntheft does not affect your main credit file, it often doesn't hit your credit\nreport, nor will a fraud alert or credit freeze help.&nbsp; It takes longer to find out you've been\nvictimized, making it harder for you to clear your name. When the criminals run\nup thousands of dollars of debt and disappear, the creditors will eventually\nback track to you.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic identity\ntheft has been around for a while, but it is having more of an impact than it\nused to.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About 4% of\napplications for credit cards and cellphone accounts are synthetic identity\nthefts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PAST 28, BELOW--</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_27.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_27.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-SRjEbaElIo0/WNcJHxy6ckI/AAAAAAABR3s/AL30X5iZ7Tw7uZCKx0dhZx9cxtpHr32hwCLcB/s1600/ajit11%2B1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-SRjEbaElIo0/WNcJHxy6ckI/AAAAAAABR3s/AL30X5iZ7Tw7uZCKx0dhZx9cxtpHr32hwCLcB/s640/ajit11%2B1.jpg\" width=\"374\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "112", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8119848418622712908/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "8309246486332228619", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-24T22:37:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-03-26T05:51:49+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDkwNDg3NzA5NjczCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_12.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8309246486332228619", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 26 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 25, BELOW--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_24.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_24.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>EVER HEARD OF \u201c<span style=\"color: red;\">SWEAT EQUITY</span> \u201c &nbsp;WHICH SHASHI THAROOR GAVE HIS WIFE SUNANDA\nTHAROOR ?<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>ALMOST EVERY IPL CRICKET TEAM IS SHORED UP BY\nOFF SHORE SHELL COMPANIES.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>EVERYBODY KNOWS THIS !<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WE KNOW WHO ALL IN MEDIA AND THE GOVT MADE\nMONEY BY NOT REPORTING THIS..</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sweat\nequity is a party's contribution to a project or enterprise in the form of hajaaar\neffort and toil, as opposed to financial equity such as paying others to\nperform the task.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sweat equity has an\napplication in business for example where the owners put in specific intellect\n, effort and toil to build the business and thus creates &nbsp;measurable market rate value.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sweat equity, in\nthe context of real estate, refers to value-enhancing improvements made by\nhomeowners to their properties. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;\u201cSweat equity shares\u201d means such equity\nshares, which are issued by a Company to its directors or employees at a\ndiscount or for consideration, other than cash, for providing their specific technological\nknow-how or making available rights in the nature of intellectual property\nrights or value additions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In\nessence, sweat equity shares are issued by a company to its employees or\ndirectors at a discounted rate or for consideration other than cash<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sunanda\nPushkar was made a Director of the company on 25 February 2010, just 18 days\nbefore the IPL bid.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There were allegations that Shashi Tharoor had misused his\nministerial position to ask for a free stake in the company, and that girl\nfriend&nbsp; Sunanda was acting as a proxy for\nhim.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The controversy ultimately resulted in Shashi Tharoor's resignation as a\nminister. In her defence, Sunanda argued that she had been invited to join\nRendezvous because of her \"extensive international experience as a\nbusiness executive, marketing manager and entrepreneur\" ( BAAAP RE ! )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Only\nan employee or director of the company is entitled to such a stake--&nbsp; &nbsp;while\nin the case of Sunanda ( before marriage&nbsp;\nto Tharoor ) her purported role of a sales and marketing consultant with\nRSW ( Rendezvous Sports World ) is a clear question mark.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Rule 6\nbars a company from issuing sweat equity shares of more than 15% of total paid\nup equity share capital in a year or shares in excess of the value of Rs. 5\ncrore, whichever is higher&nbsp; . &nbsp;&nbsp;This\nmust not exceed Rs. 5 crores in value\u2014while Sunanda Pushkar received 18% equity\nat a valuation of Rs. 70 crore<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A\nseparate resolution for approval of shareholders in the general meeting would\nbe necessary if the sweat equity stake is equal to or more than 1% of the\nissued capital on the date of such issuance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;In the event the ceiling is to be exceeded,\nprior approval of the central government would be required\u2014there was no prior\ngovernment approval.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the\ninstant case, the reported issue of sweat equity was for Rs. 70 crores, i.e.\nover and above the ceiling stipulated under the said Sweat Equity Rules and\nthat too without prior Central Government approval. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nCompanies Act also stipulates a pre-condition that at least 1 year should have\nelapsed from the day of commencement of business by the company on the date of\nissuance of sweat equity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nCompanies Act, 1956 stipulates that sweat equity shares should be of the same\nclass as already issued by the company and such an issuance is required to be\nauthorized by a special resolution passed in the general meeting. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This special resolution must specify, inter\nalia, the number of shares, current market price, and class or classes of\ndirectors or employees to whom these equity shares are to be issued.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Rule 4 of\nthe aforesaid Sweat Equity Rules requires an explanatory statement to be\nannexed to the notice for the said general meeting, which includes the\nreasons/justification for the issue, the number of shares, consideration and\nthe person's relationship with the company.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">What\nis unique about this contractual arrangement between RSW and Sunanda Pushkar is\nthat the sweat equity issued was supposedly \u2018undilutable in perpetuity\u2019 and\nthat it had a lock-in period of just 2 years, whereas the Companies Act nowhere\nprovides for \u201cundilutable sweat equity in perpetuity\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Rule\n10 of the Sweat Equity Rules prescribes a minimum lock-in period of three years\nfor sweat equity, which means that the equity so issued cannot get cashed out\nbefore the expiry of three years from the date of allotment.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Pursuant to section 77A of the Companies Act,\nthere are specific regulations regarding the buyback of shares including where\nthe company must get the resources for the buy back and objectives, conditions\nand procedures for the buy back of shares.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Section\n79A(c) of the Companies Act, 1956 (1 of 1956) (the \u201cCompanies Act\u201d), states\nthat a company may issue sweat equity shares only after completing a year since\nits incorporation.&nbsp; &nbsp;Rendezvous Sports was incorporated only in\nAugust 2009 and therefore a year has not elapsed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Shashi\nTharoor stated that Rendezvous had issued sweat equity to its associates, ie.\nSundanda Pushkar in lieu of a salary as this is \u201ccommon practice across the\nworld for start up ventures\u201d. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Maaan you fucked it up real bad !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sweat\nequity allows a brainy guy t partner up with a money bag with NO brains .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 18.6667px;\">Below: Sweat equity party Moose and Dilton -- &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 18.6667px;\">Wonder where Sunanda baby fits in ?&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">She wrangled 70-crore sweat equity or the Rs 400-crore\nfacilitation pact</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 18.6667px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-la74JNBdHWw/WNVqyMqGL5I/AAAAAAABR1c/DnlzV4igm-w5LktvQbWtWBAfVfeKY9TzACLcB/s1600/diltmdoo.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; line-height: 200%;\">Sweat equity shares are typically used to\nencourage dumb work horse Moose, &nbsp;Richie Rich &nbsp;and brainy Dilton entrepreneurs to form\nstart-up ventures.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">Below: Money bag who gives the sweat equity</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2LjiGshjXd0/WNVqtzOkMcI/AAAAAAABR1Y/sbJKHc5lI5UCfZXUozobzRvKGjbZUGC5gCLcB/s1600/ieemages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
