, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">However, there are specific regulations in India which must\nbe followed regarding the issuance of sweat equity shares.&nbsp; There are wise checks and balances in the\nsystem.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As you\ncan see ALL Company Act rules have been flouted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">Below: Third marriage couple !</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vJf945Ldwnc/WNVo0lw95oI/AAAAAAABR1I/7c3JDeZW8R04dgmUNKr7xCvTT0Z0c1H7wCEw/s1600/18fir14-1_300xD350_011814115338.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vJf945Ldwnc/WNVo0lw95oI/AAAAAAABR1I/7c3JDeZW8R04dgmUNKr7xCvTT0Z0c1H7wCEw/s640/18fir14-1_300xD350_011814115338.jpg\" width=\"548\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 15 January 2014, a\nseries of intimate messages, supposedly sent by the Pakistani journalist Mehar\nTarar to Tharoor, were posted on Tharoor's Twitter account.&nbsp; &nbsp;The\nmessages proclaimed Tarar's love for Tharoor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shortly before her\ndeath, Sunanda stated that she had taken upon herself \"the crimes of this\nman [ husband Shashi Tharoor] during IPL\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;On 17 January 2014, a day after the Twitter\ncontroversy, Sunanda was found dead in room number 345 of the Leela Palace\nhotel in Chanakyapuri, New Delhi.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 1 July 2014,\ncontroversy over her death deepened when AIIMS doctor Prof Sudhir Kumar Gupta\nclaimed that he was pressured to give a false report in the case.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dr Gupta, who was\nheading the panel that conducted the post-mortem of Sunanda, has filed an\naffidavit in the Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) stating that he was\npressurised by former union minister and president of AIIMS Ghulam Nabi Azad to\nact in an \u201cunprofessional\u201d manner to cover up the matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 10 October 2014 the\nmedical team probing her death concluded that she died of poisoning.&nbsp;&nbsp; On 6 January 2015 Delhi Police reported that\nSunanda was murdered and filed FIR in the regard. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.dailymail.co.uk/indiahome/indianews/article-3108122/Doctor-asked-fake-report-Sunanda.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.dailymail.co.uk/indiahome/indianews/article-3108122/Doctor-asked-fake-report-Sunanda.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2010, the company\nRendezvous Sports World&nbsp; bid for the\nIndian Premier League (IPL) cricket team Kochi Tuskers Kerala, which\nrepresented Tharoor's native state Kerala. Sunanda Pushkar had equity stakes in\nRendezvous Sports World (RSW), heading the&nbsp;\nconsortium that owns the Kochi team. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was later disclosed by\nLalit Modi ( opening a can of worms ) that Sunanda got sweat equity of the\nvalue of Rs 70 crore for HOLD YOUR BREATH --future consultancy work<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Law Minister Ravi\nShankar Prasad declared that Sunanda Pushkar was not entitled to sweat fuckin\u2019\nequity as per the government rules.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shashi Tharoor\nmaintained that the amount had nothing to do with his active campaigning and\nmentoring for the Kochi team. This was less convincing as he had specifically\nmentioned that he had no specific gains from RSW winning Kochi Franchisee.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">IPL IS A CORRUPT\nCIRCUS USING OFFSHORE SHELL COMPANIES, &nbsp;WITH COMPANY OWNERS BETTING </span>ILLEGALLY<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">THE BIG FISH ( TEAM\nOWNERS ) &nbsp;TRIED TO PUT THE BLAME ON SMALL\nFISH &nbsp;( PLAYERS ) &nbsp;AND SCOOT</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/travesty-of-justice-sreesanth-and.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/travesty-of-justice-sreesanth-and.html</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mumbai Police arrested Gurunath\nMeiyappan ( Chennai Super Kings ) for betting and having links with bookies.&nbsp; Rajasthan Royals team co-owner Raj Kundra was\nquestioned by the Delhi Police for involvement in illegal betting. Raj baby was\nsuspended from the IPL by the BCCI on 10 June 2013.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 25 March 2014, the\nSupreme Court of India told N. Srinivasan to step down from his position on his\nown as BCCI president in order to ensure a fair investigation into the betting\nand spot-fixing charges levied against his son-in-law Gurunath Meiyappan who\nwas team principal of Chennai Super Kings, else it would pass verdict asking\nhim to step down. &nbsp;The Supreme court said it was \"nauseating\" that N.\nSrinivasan continued as BCCI chief<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Lalit Kumar Modi (was the first Chairman and\nCommissioner of the Indian Premier League (IPL), and ran the tournament for\nthree years until 2010.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In 2010, Modi alleged that the Indian\nNational Congress minister Shashi Tharoor held indirect free equity in the\nKochi Tuskers Kerala IPL franchise, ultimately leading to Tharoor's resignation\nas a cabinet minister ( MEA ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sunanda baby hasn't invested a rupee, yet her\n70 crore stake will keep rising, as IPL does better and the Kochi franchise\nbuilds its business. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Other IPL Kochi financiers will have to keep\ninfusing funds; other shareholders' stakes will diminish as fresh shares are\nissued. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But Pushkar and Rendezvous's share will\nremain unchanged. Also, Sunanda baby can sell her stake at any point.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">MAJJA &nbsp;HAI !<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">ITHNA &nbsp;CHENGA\n&nbsp;SWEAT &nbsp;FUCKIN\u2019 &nbsp;EQUITY !<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">HAMAARA SWEAT EQUITY KITHE ? , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Khan's company Red\nChillies Enterprises Private Limited (RCEPL), the agency said, is a\nwholly-owned subsidiary of Red Chillies International Limited based overseas in\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">Bermuda </span>and is co-owned by Gauri.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the success of\nIPL, about two crore additional shares were issued by KRSPL out of which 50\nlakh shares were issued to The Sea Island Investment Ltd (TSIIL), <span style=\"background-color: white;\">Mauritius </span>and\n40 lakh shares were issued to Chawla.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Bermuda</span> earned the\ndubious distinction of ranking No. 1 on Oxfam's 2016 list of the world's worst\ncorporate tax havens using shell companies . Bermuda features a zero percent\ncorporate tax rate, as well as no personal income tax rate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Mauritius </span>is a popular\ngateway for foreign investments using shell companies , particularly those\ndirected to India. &nbsp; Mauritius has a low corporate tax rate and no withholding\ntax. &nbsp; It also does not participate in international taxation anti-abuse and\ntransparency initiatives, making it an attractive tax haven.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the way, Tokushichi\nNomura II and his father Nokushichi Nomura&nbsp;\nwere &nbsp;Jew Rothschild\u2019s agents-- &nbsp;a mere local BENAMI front for brokerage firm Nomura\nSecurities<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foreign investors\nwanting to buy smaller quantities of Indian debt and stocks can use two routes.\nOne, by registering with the market regulator SEBI as foreign portfolio\ninvestors (FPIs) and investing in to India.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who do not wish to register\nwith SEBI can buy Indian assets by buying participatory notes. Foreigners\nwilling to buy larger stake in to Indian companies use the Foreign Direct\nInvestment (FDI) route.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If FDI investors are\nlong-terminvestors, FPIs are medium or short term investors and P-note buyers\nare ultra short term investors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">P-notes are contracts\nissued by FPIs to entities outside India. These contracts have either equity, debt\nor derivatives as underlying.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many foreign investors preferred to use this\nroute for investing in to India as it was speedier and required lesser\nregulatory compliance. &nbsp;Most of them are\nrogues who have salted their bribes/ kickback money offshore&nbsp; .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Others used this channel to hide their\nidentity from the Indian regulator.</span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-size: large;\">Registered foreign\nportfolio investors such as JP Morgan, HSBC, Goldman Sachs and UBS issue\nP-Notes. </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">P-Notes are instruments\nissued by registered foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) to overseas investors,\nwho wish to invest in the Indian stock market without registering themselves\nwith the market regulator.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">They DELIBERATELY the investor\u2019s\nidentity to be kept anonymous. &nbsp; A lot of them were ministers in the govt of the\nItalian waitress.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;P-Notes accounted for over 60% of total\nforeign holdings in the recent past</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dividends from the\nstocks purchased are transferred to the end investor. The anonymous nature of\ntransaction, DELIBERATELY opens the door for unscrupulous behaviour.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\nhedge fund participating through this mode may be able to influence the\nvolatility and buying behaviour of the market participants artificially without\nrevealing its intention or identity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Round\ntripping money into the capital market through tax havens with the help of\nP-notes is happening and Indian Govt does NOT have a clue.. The question mark\nover the identity of the final beneficiary also lead to suspicion of money\nlaundering through these contracts</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The opaqueness of the transaction leads to\nthe returns being used for terrorist activities.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">INDIA IS THE ONLY\nNATION ON THE PLANET WHERE INDIAN BANKS GIVE LOANS TO TERRORISTS TO BLEED\nBHARATMATA</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SEBI has recently taken\na series of actions to tighten regulation to prevent the misuse of this\nchannel. Greater scrutiny has now brought the total assets managed as P-Notes\nfrom 60 per cent in 2007 to 12 per cent today.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SEBI has recently\ndirected P-note issuers to collect the same details on \u2018Know your customer\u2019\nfrom the P-note buyers as SEBI does for the domestic investors. FPIs have also\nbeen directed to report details about onward issuances of these contracts. A\nP-note buyer is also now required to inform the issuer before he transfers the\ncontract to another entity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">P-Notes are an opaque\nroute for investment which leaves room for round-tripping\u2014the practice of money\nstashed away overseas by Indians returning home through tax havens in the garb\nof foreign capital\u2014and money laundering.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everybody knows this .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why do we allow &nbsp;P-Notes, which keeps the investor anonymous,\nwho do \u201cmulti-layering\u201d, which makes it impossible to know the actual\nbeneficiaries.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">P notes are\ntransferable in nature. This makes tracing the \u201ctrue beneficial owner\u201d of P\nnotes even more difficult since layering of transactions can be made so complex\nso as to make it impossible to track the \u201ctrue beneficial owner\u201d.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SEBI needs to\nexamine if this provision of allowing transferring of P notes is in any way\nbeneficial for easing foreign investment. Any investor wanting to invest\nthrough P notes can always invest afresh through an Foreign Portfolio Investor\n(FPI) instead of buying from a P note holder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Organized Crime and\nCorruption Reporting Project (OCCRP), founded in 2006, is a consortium of\ninvestigative centers, media and journalists operating in Eastern Europe, the\nCaucasus, Central Asia and Central America. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;OCCRP is the only full-time investigative\nreporting organization that specializes in organized crime and corruption. It\npublishes its stories through local media and in English and Russian through\nits website.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deutsche Bank was hit\nwith about $630 million in penalties in January over an unrelated $10 billion\nRussian money-laundering scheme. French bank BNP Paribas (BNPQF) pleaded guilty\nin 2014 to violating U.S. money laundering laws by helping clients dodge\nsanctions on Iran and Sudan.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2012, HSBC paid $2 billion to settle U.S.\nallegations that it allowed drug cartels to move billions of dollars across\nborders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">HERE IS WHAT JEWISH\nBANKS DECLARE </span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">HSBC</span>: \"HSBC is\nstrongly committed to fighting financial crime. The Bank has systems and\nprocesses in place to identify suspicious activity and report it to the\nappropriate government authorities. This case highlights the need for greater\ninformation sharing between the public and private sectors, each of whom holds\nimportant information the other does not.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Standard Chartered</span>:\n\"In line with our commitment to preventing fraud, money laundering and\nterrorist financing, we will investigate any indications of suspicious activity\nand if appropriate report those findings to law enforcement.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Royal Bank of Scotland</span>:\n\"We are committed to combating financial crime and money laundering in\nline with our regulations and have controls and safeguards in place to\nidentify, assess, monitor and mitigate these risks.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">UBS</span>: \"UBS applies\na robust money laundering prevention framework across its business operations\nglobally, consistent with locally applicable regulations. On a global basis, we\nfile a significant four-digit number of reports on suspicious activities to\nanti-money laundering authorities every year.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Citi</span>: \"Among our\nmost serious obligations as a bank is to achieve the strongest possible system\nfor anti-money laundering and sanctions compliance to protect the financial\nsystem from being used as a tool by criminals and terrorists. We continually\ntake steps to strengthen and enhance our anti-money laundering program in order\nto anticipate and respond to the changing patterns of criminal and terrorist\nbehavior.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">ING</span>: \"Obviously we\nhave specific policies and regulations regarding client and transaction\nscreening and monitoring to prevent us from being used by criminals. When\napplicable, we report to and work with relevant authorities. However, it is\nING's policy not to comment publicly on individual clients, transactions or\ninvestigations.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Barclays</span>:\n\"Barclays complies with the rules and regulations in all the jurisdictions\nin which it operates and has systems and controls in place to mitigate the risk\nof the bank being used to facilitate financial crime. This includes risk based\nsystems and procedures to monitor ongoing customer activity, which we\nconstantly review, and procedures for reporting matters to the relevant law enforcement\nauthorities as appropriate. In addition, through a number of industry\ninitiatives, Barclays partners closely with global law enforcement in the fight\nagainst financial crime.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">WHERE IS MY BANANA ?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-C3adD6oqq18/WNafnLmeaMI/AAAAAAABR3M/Rvc_BplEz_w-mnapnO2aAgF2wktZmEhMACLcB/s1600/I-Dunno-Bananas-And-StuffWW-Funny-Monkey-Meme-Picture.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-C3adD6oqq18/WNafnLmeaMI/AAAAAAABR3M/Rvc_BplEz_w-mnapnO2aAgF2wktZmEhMACLcB/s640/I-Dunno-Bananas-And-StuffWW-Funny-Monkey-Meme-Picture.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">\u201cYou know, if you\u2019re caught with an ounce of\ncocaine, the chances are good you\u2019re going to go to jail. If it happens\nrepeatedly, you may go to jail for the rest of your life. But evidently, if you\nlaunder nearly a billion dollars for drug cartels and violate our international\nsanctions, your company pays a fine and you go home and sleep in your own bed\nat night.\u201d U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 10 April 2006, a\nDC-9 jet landed in the port city of Ciudad del Carmen. Inside the jet were 128\ncases packed with 5.7 tons of cocaine, valued at $100m.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During an almost two\nyear investigation by the DEA and the IRS it emerged that the smugglers had\nbought the plane with money they had laundered through one of the biggest banks\nin the United States: Wachovia, now part of Wells Fargo.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The authorities\nuncovered billions of dollars in wire transfers, traveler's checks and cash\nshipments through Mexican exchanges into Wachovia accounts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Criminal proceedings\nwere brought against Wachovia but, even though it was the biggest action ever\nbrought under the US bank secrecy act, the case never made it to court. In\nMarch 2010, Wachovia settled through the US district court in Miami and the\nbank is now in the clear.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Lebanese bank accused\nof laundering drug money through U.S. banks and routing it to Hezbollah will\npay $102 million to settle a 2011 lawsuit brought by the U.S. government.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The U.S. accused the\nLebanese Canadian Bank (LCB) of using the U.S. banking system to launder\nproceeds from drug trafficking through West Africa and back to Lebanese\nfinancial institutions with ties to Hezbollah.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">The\nprofits KOSHER &nbsp;banks can make from\nhandling dirty money far outweigh the sanctions they currently face for getting\ncaught. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There\nis a fairly simple answer to this. &nbsp;Senior executives have to be held personally\naccountable when their banks break the rules, or else it will keep happening. &nbsp;We have to overhaul the system, or we will\nkeep giving the criminal and corrupt a free pass. </span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: red;\">WE\nNEED TO JAIL THE CORRUPT BASTARD BANKERS</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2854047729999481738\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration: none;\">March 25, 2017 at 10:32 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_73MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nDear sir,Sebi directed India's largest private sector company Reliance Industries to pay up - within 45 days \u2014 Rs 447 crore plus interest on it at 12% for almost 10 years \u2014 which adds up to nearly Rs 1,000 crore \u2014 for alleged fraudulent trading in RPL shares long back from 2007. Sir u may know so many traders and investors lost money in RPL and RNRL.It was the clear insider trading RILis in the process of to prefer an appeal and challenge the order in the Securities Appellate Tribunal.</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_73BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_73b+seedMoeMD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_72T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_72TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_72TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_73b+seedMoeMD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_72TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_72TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_73b+seedMoeMD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_72TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; font-size: 16px;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_72TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_72TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_73b+seedMoeMD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_72B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4345836804435548472\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_72M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_12.html?showComment=1490462020850#c4345836804435548472\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 25, 2017 at 10:43 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_72MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"color: red; font-size: xx-large;\">MUKESH AMBANI BABY WILL RUN TO SAT</b></div>\n<br />\nMAJJA HAI !<br />\n<br />\nThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is responsible for protecting the interests of investors in securities and to promote the development of, and to regulate the securities market and for all other connected matters.<br />\n<br />\nTo protect and be responsive to the needs of three groups of people (issuer of securities, investors and market intermediaries), SEBI has been invested with three necessary functions rolled-in to enable it to carry out its mandate: Quasi-legislative function = drafts regulations Quasi-judicial = passes rulings and judgments; prosecute and judge directly certain violations Quasi-executive = investigation and enforcement actions.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nSince these powers make SEBI a very powerful body, an appeal process has been created to ensure accountability. For the quasi judicial functions, there is a Securities Appellate Tribunal, which is a three-member tribunal.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nSecurities Appellate Tribunal is a statutory body established under the provisions of Section 15K of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992 to hear and dispose of appeals against orders passed by the Securities and Exchange Board of India or by an adjudicating officer under the Act and to exercise jurisdiction, powers and authority conferred on the Tribunal by or under this Act or any other law for the time being in force.<br />\n<br />\nThe Union Government also reserves the right to notify as many SAT\u2019s as is needed.<br />\n<br />\nThe Securities Appellate Tribunal has only one bench that sits at Mumbai and has jurisdiction over all of India.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>WITH A COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY, WE KNOW WHAT THIS TRIBUNAL IS WORTH !</b></span><br />\n<br />\nComposition of SAT<br />\n<br />\nSAT shall consist of the following:<br />\n<br />\nOne Presiding officer<br />\nTwo other members<br />\nPresiding Officer<br />\n<br />\nThe Presiding Officer of SAT shall be appointed by the Central Government in consultation with the Chief Justice of India or his nominee.<br />\n<br />\nThe person to be appointed as the Presiding Officer must;<br />\n<br />\nBe a sitting or retired Judge of the Supreme Court ; or<br />\nBe a sitting or retired Chief Justice of a High Court ; or<br />\nBe a sitting or retired Judge of a High Court, who has completed atleast 7 years of service.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BRAAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY !</b></span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_73b+seedMoeMD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_73b+seedMoeMD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SEBI, in a 54-page\nruling, said Reliance had as a result made a profit of 5.1 billion rupees and\nordered it to forfeit 4.5 billion rupees plus interest within 45 days. India's\nmarket regulator accused Reliance Industries on Friday of having committed a\n\"fraud\" in taking a short trading position at the time of selling a\nstake in a subsidiary in 2007, ordering it to surrender 4.5 billion rupees ($69\nmillion) plus interest in \"unlawful gains\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In its ruling SEBI\nalleged that before Reliance Industries sold a 5 percent stake in Reliance\nPetroleum in November 2007, when it was a separately listed company, it took\nderivative short positions through third parties in Reliance Petroleum shares,\nto profit from an ensuing fall in the price following the sale.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">LOSER LAWYER TURNED JUDGES WHO WILL SCORE ZERO IN AN EXAM I WILL ASK THEM TO ANSWER RULES BHARATMATAs DESTINY</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; IMG did business with Fashion\nTV for years before it won the contract for managing IPL.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IMG, a powerful\nglobal firm with interests in sports, media and entertainment, was to get 10%\nof IPL\u2019s revenues as management fee.&nbsp;&nbsp; In\nJuly 2008, following murmurs that this was too sweet a deal, BCCI terminated\nthe contract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2013, a BCCI\ncommittee found Modi guilty on 8 charges, which resulted in his expulsion from\nBCCI. The committee was led by the BCCI vice-president and BJP leader Arun\nJaitley; its other members included the Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia\nand Chirayu Amin. The charges against Modi included:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rigging bids: Adding\ntwo onerous clauses to the invitation to tender draft without informing the\nBCCI, to favour two bidders. (Modi claimed that he had verbally informed the\nBCCI President Shashank Manohar).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Threatening a\nrepresentative of the Kochi Tuskers Kerala to give up their franchise rights or\nface sanctions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Favouring World Sports\nGroup (WSG) for TV rights<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Misconduct of\nthreatening to \"expose certain individuals in the BCCI\" via tweets<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Media\nmogul Rupert Murdoch\u2019s son Lachlan, too, has a stake.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The list of alleged tax\nevaders, who have stashed away billions of rupees in off shore accounts,\ncomprises the owners of Kochi IPL franchisee -- Dilip, Arun and Harshad Ramnik\nLal Mehta -- who are among the biggest diamond merchants in the world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mehtas, who own 12\nper cent stake in Kochi IPL, have secret accounts in LGT Bank of Leichenstein.\nThey allegedly siphoned funds through fronts which have money trails linked to\ntax havens in Luxembourg and Guernsey. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diamond firm Rosy Blue,\nin which the Mehtas hold shares, was used to park funds abroad. Shell companies\ncontrolled by secretive trusts in Guernsey were also used to siphon off funds.\nPine Trust and Beech Settlement used Deutsche Bank as trustees to illegally\npark money.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A company registered,\nsay, in Mauritius can borrow funds from an entity in another off-shore tax\nhaven like Cayman Islands, compelling tax authorities to look beyond Mauritius\nto track the money trail.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today, India does\nnot have tax information exchange agreements with tax havens, including Cayman\nIslands or Bermuda, though it has initiated the process of negotiating pacts\nwith these countries.&nbsp; So, verifying the\nownership of some of the IPL franchisees could take a long while if the money has\ncome through many jurisdictions.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">We ask Donald Trump to\nuse G20 summit at Germany to put the screws on Shell Companies&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Create a world wide\ntreaty where these countries which harbor off shore entities will have to share\ninformation if the treaty partner places a request.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Rajasthan\ngovernment is mulling action against both Modi and his wife Minal, who as\ndirectors of a company, were allegedly involved in the purchase of the heritage\nbuildings or havelis.. in the protected Amer Palace zone<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Amer Heritage City Construction\nPvt Ltd, which later changed its name to Ananda Heritage Hotels, with Lalit\nModi and his wife as directors, had purchased four government havelis.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Police sources admitted\nthey had received complaints about black marketing of tickets. However, no\nofficial complaint had so far been lodged.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;C<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">omplimentary tickets were &nbsp;sold at as much as Rs 60,000- 1.50 lakh<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IPL was initiated by\nthe Board of Control for Cricket in India.&nbsp;\nAs soon as it was formulated many people cried out loud that the sole\npurpose of IPL is to launder money.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Match fixing and\nbetting is not allowed in India. But many Indians are participating in betting\nfor IPL through many online websites from Mauritius, UK, South Africa and Nigeria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;IPL is a major source for some individuals or\nparties to bring that money from Swiss banks to India for utilize it in\ninvesting in various business firms. NRI, Non resident Indian play an important\nrole in this conversion. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we analyze\nthe owners of IPL teams , then we can see huge NRI presence in shareholders. &nbsp;As per laws in India, an NRI can bring tons of\nmoney through his account to invest in India without any barrier or using some\nsimple formalities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mauritius is top among\nthese because an investing NRI in Mauritius can bring huge amount &nbsp;of money from any Swiss Bank account to their\noperating account in Mauritius.
