Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_21.html?showComment=1490104818010#c6886261732501876592\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 21, 2017 at 7:30 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_50MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">THERE IS A DIFFERENCE BETWEEN HONORABLE WHISTLE BLOWING TO PROTECT THE WATAN , SELFISH SNITCHING/ SNEAKING AND CH00TIYA MALAFIDE CHUGLI.</span></b>.....<br />\n<br />\nTHIS ARMY SAHAYAK IS A CHUGLI --WITH ZERO HONOUR , WHO TOOK TO SOCIAL MEDIA TO WASH DIRTY LINEN...........<br />\n<br />\nWE DONT EXPECT OUR GENERALS TO DO MENIAL TASKS .... PERIOD !..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">PUT BELOW COMMENT IN CJIs, SWAMYs, YOGI ADITYANATHs, LAW MINISTERs, ATTORNEY GENERALs, PM MODIs, RAJNATH SINGHs WEBSITES ..&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">ALSO SPREAD ON SOCIAL MEDIA&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "56", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/3402032261043842162/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "2985695965280933665", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-21T00:23:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-03-21T19:55:53+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDkwMTA2MzUzMzI5Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_21.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2985695965280933665", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 22 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 21, BELOW--</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_20.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_20.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian companies are\nmisusing public trusts for money laundering.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Registrar of\nCompanies (ROC) is an office under the Indian Ministry of Corporate Affairs\nthat deals with administration of the Companies Act 1956 and Companies Act,\n2013.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are currently 22 Registrars of Companies (ROC) operating from\noffices in all major states of India. The Registrar of Company takes care of\ncompany registration (also known as incorporation) in India, completes\nreporting and regulation of companies and their directors and shareholders, and\nalso oversees government reporting of various matters including the annual\nfilling of various documents.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Investigation against\nany company is carried out on the basis of report of Registrar of Companies or\ninspector or in public interest into the Affairs of a company.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Further, the\nprocess of incorporation of a company has been strengthened through inclusion\nof various provisions mandating proof of establishment of registered office of\na company through submission of utility bills etc., establishing identity of\ndirectors including their residential address and personal identification\nthrough mandatory Director Identification Number (DIN) allotment process and a\ndeclaration by a professional that all requirements mandated under the\nprovisions of Companies Act, 2013 have been complied with. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under section 248 of\nthe Companies Act 2013, Registrar of Companies has powers to remove name of a\ncompany from register of companies where a company fails to commence its\nbusiness within one year of its incorporation or the subscribers to the\nmemorandum have failed to pay their subscription within a period of 180 days or\nwhere a company is not carrying on any business or operation for a period of\ntwo years. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was stated by Arun\nJaitley, Minister of Corporate Affairs in written reply to a question in the\nRajya Sabha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/companies-a-z/corporate-trends/how-shell-companies-turn-black-money-of-india-inc-politicians-into-white-and-vice-versa/articleshow/20947474.cms\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/companies-a-z/corporate-trends/how-shell-companies-turn-black-money-of-india-inc-politicians-into-white-and-vice-versa/articleshow/20947474.cms</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Central Board of\nDirect Taxes (CBDT) is examining several dubious companies and they would be\nremoved from the website of Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) if found to be\nshell firms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 2 lakh\ninactive companies are under the scanner of the Registrar of Companies (RoC) as\nthe government looks to crackdown on shell companies used for evading taxes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the companies are\nde-recognized by the RoC, they will have to surrender their names and they will\nno longer able to run their business on that name.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are around 15\nlakh companies registered with ROC and more than 9 lakh companies have not been\nfiling the details regularly. The RoC is creating a filter of companies based\non the number of years that they have not been filing details for.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Prime Minister\u2019s\nOffice and Ministry of Corporate Affairs are jointly monitoring the exercise to\nidentify shell companies.&nbsp; The government\nis likely to shut down at least 7 lakh shell companies operating in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">More than 65 %&nbsp; shell companies of the registered companies\nexist only for laundering money and evading tax..<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of these companies\nhad carried out high-value transactions and deposited huge amounts of cash in\nbanks following the demonetisation of Rs 500 and Rs 1,000 currency notes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Benami Transactions\n(Prohibition) Amendment Act, 2016 (BTP Amendment Act), came int into force from\n1st November 2016. ...&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Benami Transactions (Prohibition) Amendment Act,\n2016 seeks to give the government powers to confiscate benami properties\u2014assets\nheld in the name of another person or under a fictitious name to avoid taxation\nand conceal unaccounted-for wealth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bill, which had amended the older\nBenami Transactions (Prohibition) Act, 1988, got Parliament\u2019s approval in\nAugust 2016. The term \u201cproperty\u201d will cover movable, immovable, tangible and\nintangible properties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The meaning of benami\nin hindi is \u201cwithout a name\u201d. Therefore, properties which people buy but not\nunder their own name are termed as benami properties. People often spend their\nblack money to buy assets in the name of their family members to save their\ntaxes. The PBPT Act has been amended to curb this illegal practice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transactions involved\nin purchasing benami properties are called benami transactions. The person who\nis the owner of the property on paper or the person on whose name the property\nis purchased is called benamdar. If you purchase any property in this way, it\nwill be considered benami. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When does a transaction\nbecome benami?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a person who buys a\nproperty but the consideration for the purchase is paid by someone else.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the property in\nquestion is held by someone for the benefit of the person who paid\nconsideration for the property.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the property is\nheld, carried out or made under a fictitious name. If the owner of the property\nis not aware of the ownership of property or denies knowledge of such\nownership.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the person who paid\nconsideration for the property cannot be traced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In which case are\ntransactions not considered benami<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the member of an HUF\nholds the property for his benefit or for the benefit of any other member of\nHUF &amp; the consideration for the property is paid in full out of known\nsources of HUF.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the property is held\nby a person, on behalf of another person in a fiduciary capacity &amp; includes\na trustee, executor, partner, director of company, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a person buys assets\nin the name of his spouse or kids for which the payment was done from known\nsources of income then such asset or property is not considered benami\nproperty.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a person purchases any property jointly with brother or sister or\nrelatives for which the required amount was paid from known sources, then also\nthe property does not fall in the category of benami properties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What are the penalties\nfor benami properties or transactions?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The PBPT Act defines\nbenami properties and benami transactions and prohibits them. It also\nprescribes punishment and penalties applicable when laws are violated.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It gives\nthe government powers to confiscate, properties held benami without being\nliable to pay any compensation. It also prohibits benamdar (owner on paper)\nfrom transferring the property to the real owner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Violation of PBPT Act\ncan put a person behind bars for as long as 7 years. The culprit can also be\nfined for it. The quantum of fine can be up to 25% of Fair Market Value of the\nbenami property.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Income Tax (IT)\ndept. has registered more than 230 cases across India under new Benami\nTransactions (Prohibition) Amendment Act, 2016, officials in end Feb 2017.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Only 230 cases ?<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">This is pathetic !!<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\">HEADS MUST ROLL !</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any property found\nunder the Benami Act will be confiscated by the central government without\npaying any compensation to the real holder of the property.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Persons who furnish\nfalse information to authorities under the Benami Act are prosecutable and\nmay&nbsp; beneficiary (who actually paid\nconsideration) and persons who abet and induce benami transactions are\nprosecutable and may get RI up to 7 years besides being liable to pay fine up to\n25 per cent of&nbsp; of fair market value of\nbenami property...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>WHY ONLY 25 % ? <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In July 2014, the United States formally notified Russia of a breach\nfor developing and possessing prohibited weapons.&nbsp; Putin called the treaty unsuitable for Russia\nand unfair because other countries in Asia had such weapons.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">TODAY RUSSIA CAN DESTROY THE WHOLE OF US\nMAINLAND BY 16 UNSTOPPABLE SATAN 2 &nbsp;ICBM MISSILES<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/C9lvzzH0STw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/C9lvzzH0STw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The SC on 4 July 2011, ordered the\nappointment of a Special Investigating Team (SIT) headed by former SC judge BP\nJeevan Reddy to act as a watch dog and monitor investigations dealing with the\nblack money. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">BEFORE 1947, ALMOST ALL INDIAN JUDGES WERE IN\nJEW ROTHSCHILDs PAYROLL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/FPIE8yMf80s/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/FPIE8yMf80s?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2007, Indian\nauthorities began investigating crypto JEW Hasan Ali Khan for suspicion of\nmoney laundering. He had a Swiss bank account with $8 billion in deposits.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ED &nbsp;said Khan had laundered money for\ninternational arms dealer JEW Adnan Khashoggi on several occasions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JEW Adnan Khashoggi's\nsister Samira Khashoggi Fayed married Mohammed Al-Fayed and was the mother of Princess\nDiana\u2019s lover &nbsp;Dodi Fayed. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diana fucked Dodi baby just to make Pakistani\nJEW Hasnat Khan jealous. Hasnat Khan is a distant cousin of JEW Imran Khan ,\nthe Pakistani cricketer .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JEW Hasan Ali Khan was\ncharged with serving as a front for JEW Khashoggi.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Allegedly, in 2003, Khan helped launder US$300\nmillion of money Khashoggi made through arms sales through the Zurich branch of\nSwiss bank UBS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/hasan-ali-opened-shut-accounts-to-avoid-tracing-fund-sources/articleshow/7790634.cms?intenttarget=no\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/hasan-ali-opened-shut-accounts-to-avoid-tracing-fund-sources/articleshow/7790634.cms?intenttarget=no</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia\n--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; India Today, in a later article, wrote,\n\"Hasan Ali Khan stands accused of massive tax evasion and stashing money\nin secret bank accounts abroad. But the problem is that the law enforcement\nagencies have precious little evidence to back their claims. For one, UBS\nZurich has already denied having any dealings with Khan.\"[24] Indian\ngovernment has asked the Indian mission in Berne to get in touch with banking\nauthorities of Switzerland for obtaining details about Hasan Ali Khan's Swiss\nbank accounts.[25] Hasan Ali named Praful Patel during hawala\ninterrogation.[26] His business partner Tapuriah revealed that Khan had\nintimate relationships with Congress leader Renuka Chowdhury. Khan even gifted\nher a diamond worth 1.2 cr. :UNQUOTE</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hasan_Ali_Khan\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hasan_Ali_Khan</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Base erosion and profit\nshifting (BEPS) is a tax avoidance strategy used by multinational companies,\nwherein profits are shifted from jurisdictions that have high taxes (such as\nthe United States and many Western European countries) to jurisdictions that\nhave low (or no) taxes (so-called tax havens).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BEPS can be achieved through the\nuse of \"transfer mispricing\" (contracting between subsidiaries in\ndifferent jurisdictions at prices that are not arm's length). Causes for\ncontroversy around this issue can be found in \"gaps and inadequacies of\ndomestic laws, insufficient controlled foreign company rules, transfer\nmispricing, tax treaty abuses or problems arising from hybrid mismatch\narrangements\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A number of proposals\nin Indian Finance Act, 2016, are influenced from the recommendations emanating\nfrom the final reports of the OECD under its Action Plan on BEPS. &nbsp;&nbsp;The 2016 Union Budget announced an\n\u2018equalization levy\u2019 of 6 per cent on payments exceeding over Rs 1 lakh to online\nad services from non-resident entities. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thin capitalisation\nrefers to a situation where an entity is highly geared, that is, has high\nproportion of debt as compared to equity. Assessees claim excessive deduction\nfrom their taxable income by way of interest expense which is a tax deductible\nexpense.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Certain jurisdictions treat the excessive debt as equity and disallow\ntax deductibility of the corresponding interest expense.&nbsp; Existing Provision: There is no specific law\nin India with regard to thin capitalisation. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A company is said to be thinly capitalised\nwhen the level of its debt is much greater than its equity capital, i.e. its\ngearing, or leverage, is very high. An entity's debt-to-equity funding is\nsometimes expressed as a ratio. For example, a gearing ratio of 1.5:1 means\nthat for every $2 of equity the entity has $3 of debt.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thin capitalisation\nrules determine how much of the interest paid on corporate debt is deductible\nfor tax purposes. Thin capitalisation will not allow companies to claim tax\ndeduction for interest paid on foreign debt above 30% of their EBITDA (earnings\nbefore interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Multinational company &nbsp;tax avoidance and aggressive tax planning is a\nsignificant fiscal risk to the country. Money is mobile so a multinational can\nsimply shift debt into high tax counties to ensure that a tax deduction is\nreceived for the interest paid.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;This reduces the overall profits in the high\ntax country, thereby reducing their tax liability.. The OECD has &nbsp;recognised that the ability of multinationals\nto adjust the amount of debt to achieve favourable tax results is a serious\nglobal problem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Finance Bill 2017\nproposed few changes in relation to transfer pricing and aligning the Indian\nregulations to the Base Erosion and Profit Sharing ('BEPS') Action Plan.\nGovernment of India via Finance Bill, 2017 has proposed to introduce a new\nsection, section 94B in the Income Tax Act, 1961 to overcome loss of revenue by\nway of thin capitalization<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The OECD proposals are\ndesigned to ensure that profits are taxed where the underlying economic\nactivity occurs and where value is created.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thin capitalisation\nconcept would apply to all companies operating in India beginning April 2017,\nin line with the Base Erosion and Profit Shifting (BEPS) framework, a global\nagreement with 15 action points to check tax avoidance by multinationals. India\nhas already adopted some of these points. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVEN TODAY INDIA DOES\nNOT KNOW WHAT ALL GAAND MASTI ENRON DID UNDER OUR NOSES. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Enron scandal did\nnot burst out, fully grown, in a matter of days. Widespread corner cutting,\nsteadily falling standards and compromised financial discipline had been\nfestering for close to a decade.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warnings about funny numbers and unrealistic\nexpectations went unheeded, and investors celebrated reckless or\nincomprehensible business strategies that helped the stock price defy the laws\nof gravity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FOR MANMOHAN SINGH THE\nWHITE JEWs SHIT DID NOT SMELL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;WE GOT OVERAWED BY WHITE SKIN AND WHITE MANs\nBRAINS\u2014NOT ANY MORE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today, searching for\nEnron gives us results in the form of case studies in crony capitalism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/kleptocracy-in-india-lobbying-pimping.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/kleptocracy-in-india-lobbying-pimping.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crime was just one ingredient,\nalong with shocking incompetence, unjustified arrogance, compromised ethics,\nand an utter contempt for market judgment. It was Enron's tragedy to be run by\npeople smart enough to know how to maneuver around the rules, but not wise\nenough to understand why the rules had been written in the first place.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It took the\nshortcomings of a handful of executives along with a community of bankers,\nlawyers and accountants eager to win the company's fees, a government willing\nto abide absurdly lax rules and a class of investor more interested in quick\nwealth than long term rewards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Andrew Stuart Fastow\nwas the chief financial officer of Enron Corporation\u2014 he was fired shortly\nbefore the company declared bankruptcy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fastow was one of the key figures\nbehind the complex web of off-balance-sheet special purpose entities (limited\npartnerships which Enron controlled) used to conceal Enron's massive losses in\ntheir quarterly balance sheets. By unlawfully maintaining personal stakes in\nthese ostensibly independent ghost-entities, he was able to defraud Enron out\nof tens of millions of dollars..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fastow served a six-year prison sentence for\ncharges related to these acts. His wife, Lea Weingarten, also worked at Enron,\nwhere she was an assistant treasurer; she pleaded guilty to conspiracy to\ncommit wire fraud, money laundering conspiracy and filing fraudulent Income Tax\nreturns<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fastow utilized a\n\"thin capitalization\" rule to put debt off balance sheet, with equity\ncontributions as low as three percent. He even cheated on that, having the\nequity put up by related parties (including the gay partner of an Enron\nexecutive), or even, with subterfuge, by Enron itself, thus voiding all the\ndeals.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These deals carried about half the debt of the company, made Fastow\nabout $45 million one year, were unreported to the board of directors, and were\nunsupportable by Enrons' cash flow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fastow was initially\ncharged with 78 counts of fraud, mostly connected to his central role in a web\nof off-balance sheet entities that did business with Enron, disguised the\ncompany\u2019s financial condition, and made Fastow tens of millions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He ultimately\npled guilty to two counts, forfeited $30 million, and agreed to testify against\nhis former bosses as a government witness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fastow insisted he got approval for\nevery single deal -- from lawyers, accountants, management, and directors --\nyet noted that Enron is still considered \u201cthe largest accounting fraud in\nhistory.\u201d He asked rhetorically, \u201cHow can it be that you get approvals ... and\nit\u2019s still fraud?\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To curb black money,\nIndia has signed TIEA with 13 countries -Gibraltar, Bahamas, Bermuda, the\nBritish Virgin Islands, the Isle of Man, the Cayman Islands, Jersey, Liberia,\nMonaco, Macau, Argentina, Guernsey and Bahrain - where money is believed to\nhave been stashed away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tax Information\nExchange Agreements (TIEA) provide for the exchange of information on request\nrelating to a specific criminal or civil tax investigation or civil tax matters\nunder investigation. This exchange of information on request was supplemented\nby an automatic process on 29 October 2014. The automatic process is to be\nbased on a Common Reporting Standard.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Double taxation is the\nlevying of tax by two or more jurisdictions on the same declared income (in the\ncase of income taxes), asset (in the case of capital taxes), or financial\ntransaction (in the case of sales taxes).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Double liability is mitigated in a\nnumber of ways, for example:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the main taxing\njurisdiction may exempt foreign-source income from tax,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the main taxing\njurisdiction may exempt foreign-source income from tax if tax had been paid on\nit in another jurisdiction, or above some benchmark to not include tax haven\njurisdictions,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the main taxing\njurisdiction may tax the foreign-source income but give a credit for foreign\njurisdiction taxes paid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another approach is for\nthe jurisdictions affected to enter into a tax treaty which sets out rules to\navoid double taxation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is not unusual for a\nbusiness or individual who is resident in one country to make a taxable gain\n(earnings, profits) in another. This person may find that he is obliged by\ndomestic laws to pay tax on that gain locally and pay again in the country in which\nthe gain was made.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since this is inequitable, many nations make bilateral\ndouble taxation agreements with each other. In some cases, this requires that\ntax be paid in the country of residence and be exempt in the country in which\nit arises<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India has comprehensive\nDTAAs with 88 countries, out of which 85 have entered into force. This means\nthat there are agreed rates of tax and jurisdiction on specified types of\nincome arising in a country to a tax resident of another country.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian black money goes\nto Mauritius, get dressed in privacy and comes back to India in name of FDI. Geographical\nproximity and cultural influence of Indian diaspora have promoted an atmosphere\nfavourable to Indian investment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A large number of\nforeign institutional investors who trade on the Indian stock markets operate\nfrom Singapore and the second being Mauritius.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the tax treaty\nbetween India and Mauritius, capital gains arising from the sale of shares are\ntaxable in the country of residence of the shareholder and not in the country\nof residence of the company whose shares have been sold.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, a company\nresident in Mauritius selling shares of an Indian company will not pay tax in\nIndia. Since there is no capital gains tax in Mauritius, the gain will escape\ntax altogether<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tax incentives in the\nDTAA were necessary to attract foreign investments in India. The DTAA provided\nclose to $100 billion of foreign direct investment (FDI) equity in India\nbetween 2000 and 2015 and accounted for 34% of FDI in India being channelled\nthrough Mauritius. Without the DTAA, unemployment in India would have been higher.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The misuse of the DTAA for round-tripping money by establishing shell\ncompanies in Mauritius was also a major concern. Local funds were being\nsquirreled out of India and returning as foreign capital, thereby avoiding\ntaxes. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was a route for terror\nfunds to India. Companies using the Mauritius global business company platform\nto invest in India under the DTAA would continue to be exempted from capital\ngains tax up to 30 March 2017.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From 1 April 2017 to 30\nMarch 2019, 50% of the domestic tax rate in India would be applicable and\nthereafter at the full rate of 100%. Instead of zero taxation interest on bank\ncredit, after 31 March 2017 it will be taxed at 7.5% with a widened scope of\nthe interest tax clause to cover non-bank debt too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The smartest tax\nevaders use a combination of bank accounts, shell companies, trusts and foundations\u2014often\nfronted by nominees\u2014in one or more offshore financial centres.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corporate tax\navoidance is a greyer legal area. Companies naturally push the envelope, often\nbetting that the authorities will have neither the wit nor the resources to\nconfront them over their tax-minimisation strategies\u2014or that governments will\naccept less tax in return for investment by \"mobile capital\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/apple-has-paid-no-income-tax-all-new-zealand-last-decade-1612685\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/apple-has-paid-no-income-tax-all-new-zealand-last-decade-1612685</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a bizarre twist in\nthe whole multinational tax minimisation saga, it has been revealed Apple New\nZealand has paid no income tax in that country for 10 years while paying $36\nmillion to the Australian Taxation Office.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Europe, Apple was in\nhot water last year for its relationship with the Irish government, which\ngranted the American tech giant special tax status. The European Commission\nordered Apple to pay $19 billion in back taxes last August, ruling Ireland had\nprovided it \u201cillegal state aid\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>WE ASK MODI\u2014</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>WHY IS IT\nTHAT NOT A SINGLE CORRUPT CONGRESS POLITICIAN IS IN JAIL ?&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>IS IT\nQUID PRO QUO ?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>OR ARE THE COLLEGIUM JUDGES SAVING THESE BASTARDS ?</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>DO YOU WANT THIS BLOGSITE TO GIVE YOU A LIST OF INDIAN POLITICIANS WHO HAVE MADE MORE THAN 100 CRORES ?</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/mar/20/how-dirty-money-from-russia-flooded-into-the-uk-and-where-it-went\">https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/mar/20/how-dirty-money-from-russia-flooded-into-the-uk-and-where-it-went</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shekhar Reddy started\nas a small contractor, riding a cycle , taking job works for Rs 10,000 to Rs\n50,000 to lay roads and for other government projects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several ministers and\nIAS officers attended the funeral of Reddy's mother 9 months ago\u2014BEEEEG mistake\n!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the 2011 assembly\nelection, he got all sand quarry contracts in Vellore and Kancheepuram\ndistricts from the Mannargudi mafia.. With strong political backing, he\nunleashed his money and muscle power to silence villagers, who opposed the\nquarrying. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Revenue officers remained\nmute spectators to the illegal mining. &nbsp;&nbsp;Reddy's\nproperties begins in Yelagiri Hills in Vellore district and spreads across\nseveral places in Andhra Pradesh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/chennai-sekhar-reddy-arrested-in-connection-with-illegal-money-exchange-case/596307/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/chennai-sekhar-reddy-arrested-in-connection-with-illegal-money-exchange-case/596307/</a><o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">MOST OF THE CORRUPTION WAS DURING THE RULE OF THE ITALIAN WAITRESS</b><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://www.bbcnewspoint.com/top-10-most-corrupt-political-party-in-the-world-2017/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.bbcnewspoint.com/top-10-most-corrupt-political-party-in-the-world-2017/</a><o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 23, BELOW--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_26.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_26.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-11nftLcEK0o/WNAka55EMfI/AAAAAAABRxs/DMUe5n19QsIzX3s0yyX9XMFYrQvkV3nbQCLcB/s1600/IMG-20170316-WA0002%2B%25283%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-11nftLcEK0o/WNAka55EMfI/AAAAAAABRxs/DMUe5n19QsIzX3s0yyX9XMFYrQvkV3nbQCLcB/s640/IMG-20170316-WA0002%2B%25283%2529.jpg\" width=\"428\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "71", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2985695965280933665/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "8050921944737451525", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-20T00:11:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-03-21T00:24:19+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDkwMDM2MDU5NjM0Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_20.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8050921944737451525", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 21 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 20, BELOW---</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_19.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_19.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A limited company (LC)\nis a form of incorporation that limits the amount of liability undertaken by\nthe company's shareholders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The naming convention for this type of corporate\nstructure is commonly used in the United Kingdom. It is commonly known as a\nlimited liability company (LLC) in the United States and other parts of the\nworld.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a limited company,\nthe liability of members or subscribers of the company is limited to what they\nhave invested or guaranteed to the company. Limited companies may be limited by\nshares or by guarantee.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The former may be further divided into public companies\nand private companies. Who may become a member of a private limited company is\nrestricted by law and by the company's rules. In contrast, anyone may buy\nshares in a public limited company.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Limited companies can\nbe found in most countries, although the detailed rules governing them vary\nwidely.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is also common for a distinction to be made between the publicly\ntradable companies of the plc type (for example, the German Aktiengesellschaft\n(AG), British PLC, Czech a.s., Italian S.p.A. and the Spanish, French, Polish,\nGreek and Romanian S.A.), and the \"private\" types of company (such as\nthe German GmbH, British Ltd, Polish sp. z o.o., the Czech s.r.o., the Italian\ns.r.l. and Slovak s.r.o.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India, there are\nthree types of limited company: a public limited company, a private limited\ncompany, and a one-person company.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A company's liability may be limited by\nshares, in which case the liability of the company's members is limited to the\namount of the shares held by them, or it may be limited by guarantee, in which\ncase the liability is limited to a predetermined amount the company's members\nhave agreed to contribute if the company is dissolved with outstanding\nliabilities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A private limited company is a limited company incorporated under\nthe Companies Act 2013 (or one of its predecessor acts), with a minimum paid-up\nshare capital (if any) of &nbsp;Rs 1 lakh (US$1,500), with an article that restricts\nthe transfer of its shares; it may have between two and two hundred members,\nand its name ends with \"Private Limited\" (abbreviated Pvt Ltd).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\npublic limited company must have a paid-up share capital of at least 5 lakh\n(US$7,400), and at least seven members; its name ends \"Limited\"\n(abbreviated Ltd).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A one-person company (OPC) is a private company with similar\nproprietorship and privileges to a private limited company, but with fewer\nrequirements; this type of company may have only one director and member<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shell companies can be\nused to transfer assets of one company onto a new company without having the\nliabilities of the former company.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;
