A corporation\nis controlled at root by the board of directors who are elected by the\nshareholders.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The board has no direct operational control, as that is left to\nthe \"king\", the CEO; however, the board does control what everyone\nwants access to: the money.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Board members have all\nsorts of legal qualitative mandates on how to behave, and they've functioned\nfairly decently efficiently over the long run, but there are definitely some\nbad apples.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Boards are somewhat\nintransigent since it's difficult to hold board elections, and usually only\nspecific board members are put up for election by a shareholder vote, so a bad\none has the potential to really get stuck in there. Once a bad one is in there,\nthey don't care because they know it will be tough to get them out, so they run\nroughshod over the company's purse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only the board can take\naction on major funding such as the CEO's operating budget, board compensation,\nfinancing, investment, etc, some with shareholder approval, some without. The\ncorporation itself owns all of those assets, but the board controls them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this example, they\nscheme with most likely the top executive, but a rubber stamp top executive\ncould allow a lower rung to scheme with the board, but the board is always\nconstant until the law is changed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because there's no\nhonor amongst thieves, the board votes which can require some combination of\nexecutive and shareholder approval are taken very close together: sell shares,\nincrease salaries to key executive schemers, increase board compensation. The trusting\nshareholders believe this is in the best interests of the company at large so\ngo along.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So the money flows from\nexisting &amp; new shareholders to the corporation now controlled by a\nmalicious board and then finally to the necessary malicious executive and the\nvital malicious board.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Income Tax Authorities\nin India in 2006 under the leadership of the then Commissioner of Income Tax of\nBangalore GM Belagali IRS and Additional Commissioner of Income Tax, Sibichen K\nMathew IRS unearthed the 1.6 million dollar penny stock scam in Bangalore.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nscam is the fallout of nationwide income tax raids on the premises of\nbusinessmen in April 2006, suspecting large scale money laundering and tax\nevasion through ramping up shares of small firms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Around 25 premises were\nraided in Mumbai and 10 in Bangalore. After the raids, the Additional\nCommissioner set up a team and investigated this scam. They pursued the\ninvestigations and issued orders on December 31, 2008 that are said to have\nnational ramifications.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The team found that the traders had ramped up penny\nstocks to launder money an organised crime and a serious economic offence that\nhas misused provisions of the Securities and Exchange Board of India and\nRegistrar of Co-operatives. This route is chosen to use capital gains tax and\nlegalise the unaccounted money.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On April 28, the Central Board of Direct Taxes\nand the Ministry of Finance billed the case as the best investigation and\nassessment order of the year. The team picked up accounts of 30 Chikpet traders\nwho were into penny stocks and found bogus claims through capital gains.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The finding has also\ndebunked the claim that demat is sacrosanct though the depository participation\ndid not have any role in the manipulation, the demat procedure was misused.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Penny stocks provide\nfor a plethora of investment fraud. Therefore, investors must always be\nalert&nbsp; when venturing deep into the penny\nstock mine field. Following is a list of the most common types of penny stock\nscams:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fraud Methods:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">E-mail Spam. A common\npractice for a penny stock fraudster is to send deceitful information about a\npenny stock company in the form of spam or junk e-mail to myriad potential\ninvestors over the internet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Internet Fraud. Another\ninstrument of the unscrupulous is to post a supposedly \u201cinside\u201d information\nabout major company events on internet bulletin boards and chat rooms. Their\nidentity cannot be determined, because it is usually hidden behind many\naliases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Paid Promoters. Another\nway to trick investors is to pay&nbsp; stock\npromoters to spread online investment newsletters, recommending a certain penny\nstock. Besides paid newsletters, variations of online stock promotions also\ninclude research reports or radio and television shows.&nbsp; Investors should be vigilant in this cases,\nas the information they provide may often seem unbiased.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although federal\nsecurities laws require the newsletters to disclose if they have been\ncompensated to feature a certain stock, many fraudsters manage to elude this\nrule. So investors should always have a second thought about the \u201cindependent\u201d\nadvices in the investment newsletters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cold Calling. Dishonest\nbrokers assign a group of impelling sales people who use telephones to make\ncold calls to as many potential investors as possible. In such cases the\nvictims of the cold calling are pressured to buy a bad investment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Questionable Press\nReleases. It is not unusual that a penny stock company would publish a press\nrelease that contains \u201cexaggerations or lies\u201d about the penny stock company.\nThe misinformation is most likely to be about company's sales, acquisitions,\nrevenue projections, or new products or services. After that, legitimate\nfinancial news portals on the Internet circulate the false news to the public.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bait-and-switch is a\nform of fraud used in retail sales, but also employed in other contexts. First,\ncustomers are \"baited\" by merchants's advertising products or\nservices at a low price, but when customers visit the store, they discover that\nthe advertised goods either are not available or are not as good as expected,\nor the customers are pressured by sales people to consider similar, but\nhigher-priced, items (\"switching\").<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The intention of the\nbait-and-switch is to encourage purchases of substituted goods, making consumers\nsatisfied with the available stock offered, as an alternative to a\ndisappointment or inconvenience of acquiring no goods (or bait) at all, and\nreckoning on a seemingly partial recovery of sunk costs expended trying to\nobtain the bait. It suggests that the seller will not show the original product\nor service advertised but instead will demonstrate a more expensive product or\na similar product with a higher margin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the United States,\ncourts have held that the purveyor using a bait-and-switch operation may be\nsubject to a lawsuit by customers for false advertising, and can be sued for\ntrademark infringement by competing manufacturers, retailers, and others who\nprofit from the sale of the product used as bait. However, no cause of action\nwill exist if the purveyor is capable of actually selling the goods advertised,\nbut aggressively pushes a competing product.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-retail use--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bait-and-switch tactics\nare frequently used in airline and air travel advertising.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hotels widely use the\nform of bait-and-switch tactics known as 'resort fees'. They first attract\ncustomers by advertising the lower price (which appears on all promotional\nmaterials and rate comparison engines), and charge customers the mandatory\n\"resort fee\" when they arrive for check-in.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recruitment. Many\nemployers and employment agencies systematically use bait and switch tactics.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Advertising one position and after the candidate has submitted their CV or\ntaken time off work to come to a face to face interview then subtly changing\nthe nature of the position or offering a completely different position. Often\nthere is no job at all and the \"job advertisement\" is simply a\nspeculative trawl for CVs that may match HR requirements at some point in the\nfuture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Home service companies\nsuch as in the carpet cleaning, air conditioning, and security system\nindustries often use bait-and-switch.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Professional wrestling\nhas long used bait-and-switch tactics, promoting wrestlers and matches that\neither fail or refuse to appear or appear much differently than expected. A\ndisclaimer on promotional material, \"Card Subject to Change,\" is\noften used to justify or excuse this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Bait-and-switch\"\nalso refers to a form of Internet trolling, which involves luring Internet\nusers into watching certain things or entering certain prank websites using\nmisleading thumbnails, icons, or links. An example of this is Rickrolling.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/opinion/how-to-check-black-money-in-india/article9591432.ece\">http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/opinion/how-to-check-black-money-in-india/article9591432.ece</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">PM MODI HAS DONE HIS DEMONITISATION<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">APUN AWWAL !!<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">HE HAS TAKEN NO INTEREST IN ENCOURAGING\nWHISTLE BLOWERS AND PROTECTING THEM.<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">PATHETIC !</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Whistleblower protection is integral to\nfostering transparency, promoting integrity, and detecting misconduct.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Past\ncases demonstrate that corruption, fraud, and wrongdoing, as well as health and\nsafety violations, are much more likely to occur in organisations that are\nclosed and secretive.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In many cases, employees will be aware of the wrongdoing,\nbut feel unable to say anything for fear of reprisals, concern about acting\nagainst the organisation\u2019s culture, or lack of confidence that the matter will\nbe taken seriously.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The negative implications of this are far-reaching for both\norganisations and society as a whole. Effective whistleblower protection\nsupports employees in \u201cblowing the whistle\u201d on corruption, fraud or wrongdoing.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">PM\nModi MUST &nbsp;enact a dedicated\nwhistleblower protection law or legal provision related specifically to\nprotected reporting or prevention of retaliation against whistleblowers in the\npublic/ private sectors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This law\nMUST be PROACTIVE &nbsp;and forward looking\nrather than being reactive/ scandal-driven.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There\nmust be a BOLD and dedicated whistleblower protection law that has more ability\nto clarify and streamline the processes for disclosing wrongdoing and provide\nremedies for victims of retaliation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>THERE MUST BE A\nNATIONAL WHISTLEBLOWER POLICY !<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Almost all BIG FISH\nhave a mafia arm</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upon identifying\nwrongdoing, employees in the public or private sector may be uncertain of what\nto do with the information, where or to whom to turn, or whether they are\nprotected by whistleblower protection mechanisms.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The many steps along the\ndisclosure process can be daunting and vague. However, an effective and open\norganisational culture that promotes transparency and dialogue can help address\nthese concerns and may make the difference between an employee speaking out or\nstaying silent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In May 2016, internal\ninvestigators of a leading Indian public sector bank uncovered a fraud, wherein\nsome individuals, along with their cohorts, cheated the government and banks of\nseveral crores of rupees using a maze of 24 ghost companies operating from a\nsingle branch of the bank in Delhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In December 2015, in\nanother branch of another bank, CBI began investigating fake foreign exchange\nremittances aggregating R6,000 crore from non-existent imports through various\naccounts of 60 companies, all of them operating from a single branch of the bank\nand controlled by a group of individuals masterminding the fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An OECD report (Misuse\nof Corporate Vehicles for Illicit Purposes) concurs that shell companies are\nincreasingly being used for illicit purposes. India is NOT part of OECD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.oecd.org/corporate/ca/43703185.pdf\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.oecd.org/corporate/ca/43703185.pdf</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">THIS BLOGSITE SUPPORTS SOMNATH BHARTI</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/SUjnj3lyLCc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/SUjnj3lyLCc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">NCW IS NOW USING HIS OWN WIFE TO SCREW HIM&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-5XZ7QkcAsUM/WM-bhJHXA8I/AAAAAAABRxI/42KYEFr_faQ0NevvyFcrYxEDkQMxlGbMQCLcB/s1600/somssnath_bharti_raid360.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The effects of money laundering is catastrophic.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There is no official figure yet, but I estimate India\u2019s black money to the tune of&nbsp; 45%\nof its GDP.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">There is need for real-time detection and monitoring of shell\ncompanies and oversight of unusual rise in the market price of companies with\nlittle business, empowerment of enforcement agencies to act</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"> <b>without prior\napprovals</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">YOU CAN NEVER CATCH DRUG BARONS IF YOU GO VIA\nNORMAL CHANNELS ..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">NOW YOU KNOW WHY ALL\nWERE ANGRY WITH AAP LAW MINISTER SOMNATH BHARTI , WHEN AT MIDNIGHT HE WANTED\nTHE POLICE TO RAID A SEX AND DRUGS AFRICAN DEN IN DELHI\u2014</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">ALL ARE IN CAHOOTS--\nMAGISTRATES,&nbsp; COLLEGIUM JUDGES, POLICE,\nPOLITICIANS , BABUS,&nbsp; BENAMI MEDIA , NCW,\nNACM, NHRC, MUMAN RIGHTs ORGS, TROJAN HORSE NGOs etc .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">IF YOU HAVE TO GET A WARRANT AND RAID DURING\nOFFICE HOURS\u2014THIS SEX AND DRUG DEN WILL BECOME A KINDERGARTEN SCHOOL FOR\nAUTISTIC KIDS , WITH DOCTORS IN WHITE COATS IN PLACE</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b>HULLOOOO CM OF GOA\u2014PARRIKKAR \u2013&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">HULLLOOOOOOOOO\n!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/jewish-russian-mafia-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/jewish-russian-mafia-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In May 2016, internal\ninvestigators of a leading Indian public sector bank uncovered a fraud, wherein\nsome individuals, along with their cohorts, cheated the government and banks of\nseveral crores of rupees using a maze of 24 ghost companies operating from a\nsingle branch of the bank in Delhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In December 2015, in\nanother branch of another bank, CBI began investigating fake foreign exchange\nremittances aggregating R6,000 crore from non-existent imports through various\naccounts of 60 companies, all of them operating from a single branch of the\nbank and controlled by a group of individuals masterminding the fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An OECD report (Misuse\nof Corporate Vehicles for Illicit Purposes) concurs that shell companies are\nincreasingly being used for illicit purposes. India is NOT part of OECD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.oecd.org/corporate/ca/43703185.pdf\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.oecd.org/corporate/ca/43703185.pdf</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Traditionally, shell\ncompanies in India have been used for rotation and siphoning off of funds by\nthe promoters through fictitious sales, inflated purchases, unjust commissions\nor for creation of equity for ultimate owners who are shielded by cloaks of\ndeceit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The modus operandi is\nsimple. The perpetrator floats a number of companies usually with the same\nregistered address and with directors who despite being \u2018real persons\u2019 are\nuntraceable or completely unrelated, or are usually poor and unlettered lending\ntheir names for a token payment. Dummy directors are used for anonymity or\ndeniability, who pre-sign cheques and documents and hand over to the\nprincipals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All too often, bank\nofficials are hand-in-glove in these operations, including overlooking KYC\nnorms and background checks for accounts opened in their branches. Often,\nsuspicious transactions are below the threshold of automatic banking software\ntriggers and hence can go undetected for years unless they form part of other\ninvestigations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The \u2018seed\u2019 receipt is introduced as capital in the bank account\nof one shell company with the knowledge of bank officials; this money is\nrotated through bank accounts of a set of shell companies\u2014all transactions\nbeing completed the same day in the same branch of the bank. Thus, each company\nshows identical sums as capital and instantly lends or invests in another\ncompany.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The exercise is repeated several times.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As banks need to balance their\nbooks only at the end of the day, colluding bankers ensure that the money\nrotates through 5-10 accounts in a day, i.e. the money multiplies 10 times in a\nday, not backed by real transactions, but the daily credit and debit balances\nin each account falsely display robust business activity. It is very much like\nthe Panchatantra tale in which a fox shows one crocodile 10 times to its mother\nto convince her that there are 10 of them!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What happens to the\ncapital when it is created? It is pledged for bank loans, or these shares are\nvalued excessively by conniving valuers and then merged with listed companies\nwhich are dormant. Once merger fructifies, the fictitious investment gets\nconverted into real shares at high prices, and more importantly, gets liquid in\na stock exchange.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Supreme Court-appointed SIT noted in its report that\ninvestment in the secondary share markets to manipulate stocks and create\nnon-taxable capital gains is becoming popular. With the collusion of promoters,\nsome brokers arrange purchase or financing of scrips at nominal costs, and then\nmanipulate their sales at exorbitant prices to create long-term \u2018capital gains\u2019\nwhich attract nil or nominal tax.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In case of a fraud\ninvolving foreign exchange, large remittances are sent overseas towards\nfictional imports of stocks and machinery, advances, commissions, etc. Later,\nmoney is moved from such overseas accounts into another set of shell companies.\nOften, such money comes back through another bank account as receipts from\nexports or payments for share capital in listed and unlisted companies (called\nround tripping).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SIT observed that investments from Cayman Islands, a tax\nhaven, alone amount to R85,000 crore in India, highlighting the role of tax\nhavens in money laundering. In either case, the perpetrators avail import\ncredits from the government, like duty drawback on imports and export benefits.\nOtherwise, these shells hold properties or land on behalf of the real owners or\nhold payments for fictitious sale of goods or services in India till the money gets\n\u2018bleached white\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another route of\nintroducing black money into the banking system is by showing large income from\nagriculture, processing and milling of agriculture products and scarp sales,\nall outside the radar of tax nets. There are examples of tiny companies with\nvery small landholdings showing agricultural income in tens of crores of\nrupees. It is not an exaggeration to say that the output of such land would be\nmany times over the total output of the district or the total annual sales in\nthe local mandi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MCA21, the portal on\nwhich all corporate filings reside, is a wonderful starting point for tracking\nand mining data for companies sharing characteristics like common directors,\nsame registered address, little or no business, occasional large transaction,\netc, to create early warnings against shell companies. A central KYC registry\nto track multiple transactions by one individual or entity will help create\ntransaction histories of individuals and entities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MCA21 Mission Mode\nProject (MCA21) is the e-governance initiative from the Ministry of Corporate\nAffairs, Government of India. It is one of the 27 Mision Mode Projects of the\nNational e-Governance Plan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the year 2002, the\nMinistry of Corporate Affairs (then known as the Department of Company Affairs)\nwas faced with the problem of providing services to nearly 7.5 lakh corporate\nentities. Vast amounts of paperwork was to be processed. This was to be\nexpected because with globalization and interest shown by foreign companies in\nIndia, the number of documents being handled was constantly increasing even as\nthe expectations were increasing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Indian Govt\nmust&nbsp; have a mechanism for proactive\ndetection of shell companies and deterrent penal provisions against persons\ninvolved in setting them up<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Medical colleges are\nnow charging as much as two crores.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Is our Modi Govt, babes\nin the woods ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shell companies serve\nnot just as vehicles for corporate tax dodging but have also been used by the\nrich to get around paying hefty alimony payments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shell companies are\nused for the purposes of making foreign exchange transfers or to bribe\nofficials or to avail duty drawback. For instance, shell companies located\nabroad are known to be used by technology companies that develop patents in\nIndia but once developed the patents are registered in the name of shell\ncompanies incorporated in tax havens.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While demonetisation exposed the widespread misuse of shell companies,\nthe SITs&nbsp; had already flagged the issue\nin its 3rd report put out in July 2015 and recommended the proactive detection\nof shell companies through data mining of MCA21 data.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Duty-drawback-scam-accused-in-CBI-net/articleshow/37281406.cms\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Duty-drawback-scam-accused-in-CBI-net/articleshow/37281406.cms</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Duty Drawback has been\none of the principal methods of encouraging export. It is a relief by way of\nrefund/ recoupment of custom and excise duties paid on inputs or raw materials\nand service tax paid on the input services used in the manufacture of export\ngoods. Shipping bill is an essential document for claiming duty drawback.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\nrefund that can be obtained when an import fee has already been paid for a\ngood, but the good is then subsequently exported. In order to obtain a duty\ndrawback, a business does not have to have paid the import duty, nor do they\nhave had to perform the product's exportation, they only need to be assigned\nthe drawback from those to whom it would typically be due.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ahmedabad/DRI-detects-1-crore-duty-drawback-fraud-by-Surat-company/articleshow/50555707.cms\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ahmedabad/DRI-detects-1-crore-duty-drawback-fraud-by-Surat-company/articleshow/50555707.cms</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wherever the duty\ndrawback rate, as a percentage of the f.o.b. value, is higher than the going\n'hawala' rate for foreign exchange, there is an opportunity simply waiting to\nbe exploited by a cabal of unscrupulous businessmen and conniving Customs\nofficials. We will continue to witness a huge growth in bicycle part exports..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drawback&nbsp; rates fixed as a percentage of\nthe f.o.b value of exports are particularly useful for raising bogus claims.\nFor, the higher the declared f.o.b value of consignments, the higher the entitlement\nof duty drawback<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.taxindiaonline.com/RC2/inside2.php3?filename=bnews_detail.php3&amp;newsid=2756\">http://www.taxindiaonline.com/RC2/inside2.php3?filename=bnews_detail.php3&amp;newsid=2756</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.telegraphindia.com/1150815/jsp/nation/story_37368.jsp%23.WM-e0dKGPIU\">https://www.telegraphindia.com/1150815/jsp/nation/story_37368.jsp#.WM-e0dKGPIU</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ahmedabad/DRI-exposes-Rs100-crore-scam-in-mulberry-silk-drawbacks/articleshow/52275662.cms\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/ahmedabad/DRI-exposes-Rs100-crore-scam-in-mulberry-silk-drawbacks/articleshow/52275662.cms</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why are Indian banks\nhaving BAD LOANS ?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Are they just bad loans \u2013or is there something more than\nmeets the eye?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These are unique frauds\nwhere the perpetrators connived together resorting to discounting of fake\ncheques and fake inland bills against fake LIC policies and arranging\nover-draft limit against non-existent LIC policies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.livemint.com/Companies/te2wiPynZKT5TtMN7X3LNK/Syndicate-Bank-writes-off-Rs883-crore-against-fraud-at-Jaipu.html\">http://www.livemint.com/Companies/te2wiPynZKT5TtMN7X3LNK/Syndicate-Bank-writes-off-Rs883-crore-against-fraud-at-Jaipu.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/syndicate-bank-scam-cbi-pawan-bansal/1/376615.html\">http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/syndicate-bank-scam-cbi-pawan-bansal/1/376615.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.moneylife.in/article/delhi-hc-vacates-itat-stay-on-rs525-crore-penalty-on-ndtv/49995.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.moneylife.in/article/delhi-hc-vacates-itat-stay-on-rs525-crore-penalty-on-ndtv/49995.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian banks,&nbsp; are collectively saddled with more than Rs five\nlakh crore of bad loans\u2014why ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">SAB MIL BHAANTKE KHAATE\nHEIN !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The top 10 business\nhouse debtors alone owe Rs 5,00,000 crore to the banks. They will be forced to\nsell assets worth over Rs 2,00,000 crore.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/fHFh9h24NxA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fHFh9h24NxA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But some companies like\nTATA took loans to give salaries and pensions to the white man<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_129M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_11.html?showComment=1490002552613#c5623421792531206277\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 20, 2017 at 3:05 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_129MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nJRD TATAs MOTHER WAS A FRENCH WOMAN SUZANNE BRIERE ( SOONI ) \u2026. CYRUS MISTRY IS AN IRISH CITIZEN\u2026. HIS MOTHER PATSY IS IRISH\u2026 Noel Tata's mother ( Ratan Tata's step-mother ) is Simone Dunoyer -a Frenchwoman. \u2026.Only idiots will set up business in Britain, where people want money without working for it\u2026. The John Bull is very conscious of his rights and pension demands\u2026.. Tata Steel was awarded the '2015 World's Most Ethical Company' award under the Metals category by the Ethisphere Institute. \u2026\u2026.This was the third time, that Tata Steel won this award\u2026 BRAAAAYYYYYYYYY!...... SOMETIMES TO GET SUCH AN AWARD , YOU HAVE TO BECOME A CH0OT AND SIT ON CHANNE KA JHAAD\u2026\u2026 Tata Steel acquired the steel giant Corus in 2007\u2026\u2026To fend off a Brazilian rival, Companhia Sider\u00fargica Nacional (CSN) (this was a Rothschild signature trick for which only their ex-opium drug running agents fall )\u2026.. Tata had to pay a 70% premium over the stock price\u2026\u2026 Mind you, Jew Rothschild was brought in to advise Tata Steel\u2014 in addition to ABN Amro and Deutsche Bank\u2014late in the game after the Brazilian company CSN upped the stakes ( a game for CHO0TS )\u2026\u2026.. On 30/31 January an auction was held by the Panel for Corus's shares, with Tata outbidding CSN at \u00a36.08 vs \u00a36.03 per share\u2026\u2026.. CSN's bid had been supported by Goldman Sachs whilst Tata's was supported by ABN Amro, Rothschilds, and Deutsche Bank\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.. SAAB ROTHSCHILD KI LEELA THA, WITH AN EX \u2013OPIUM BUSINESS PARTNER !...... Tata paid only $4bn (\u00a32.8bn) of the estimated $14bn final price out of its own funds \u2013 the rest was borrowed, mainly from Indian public sector banks. Corus steel was acquired by Tata of India in 2007, and renamed Tata Steel Europe in September 2010\u2026\u2026. In September 2010, Corus announced that it was changing its name to Tata Steel Europe and adopting the Tata logo\u2026\u2026\u2026 WE THE PEOPLE OF INDIA WANT TO KNOW WHY ARUN JAITLEY AND MODI IS ONLY AFTER VIJAYA MALLYA\u2026\u2026. WHAT ABOUT THE LOANS TAKEN BY TATA AND OTHERS ?....... Even if Tata steel sells , the humongous GBP 15 billion British Steel Pension Scheme, a part of Tata Steel UK, has 130,000 members and will not be taken over by the new buyer\u2026.. This means the liability stays with Tata Steel\u2026\u2026. Do you have any idea how much is 15 BILLION POUNDS ? \u2026\u2026. Are these PATHETIC meat and potato Limey steel workers lords and dukes?....... Why were Indian taxpayer-funded Public sector banks so willing to lend to TATA to buy up an overpriced and defunct CORUS steel , even as they denied loans to Indian farmers committing suicide and small-scale cottage industries?........ Repayment of those loans was supposed to be made out of the profits of Tata Steel Europe. But those profits never came\u2026. Only idiots invest in British industry\u2026\u2026 British who never sweated in their lives, want to retire in luxury by making Indians pay for them ........WE HEARD RATAN TATAs CONVERSATIONS WITH NIRA RADIA \u2026..65 PARSIS WERE KNIGHTED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD BEFORE 1947, WE KNOW WHY TODAY.. capt ajit vadakayil ..</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/mqm4eO3xi9g/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/mqm4eO3xi9g?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
