The TCSPs involved carried out the\nbidding of senior banking officials who were their principals, and in so doing\nappeared to have little separate corporate identity or independence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Case: Use of shell\ncompanies to facilitate corrupt payments---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An operational business\ngoes through a TCSP with the objective of getting control (via a\nfiduciary/trust contract) of a shell company domiciled under European law,\ngiving it the appearance of being operational. The objective is to pay the\nshell company a compensation for fictitious consulting services.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This fee is\nthen paid by the TCSP, on behalf of the shell company, to a third person who in\nturn is responsible for bribing a public official who grants access to a public\nexchange to the above-mentioned operational business. This corruption can be\ndone with or without the knowledge of the TCSP.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because TCSPs provide\nservices in relation to the establishment and management of corporate structures,\ntrusts/foundations, and structuring of investments, criminals often target\nTCSPs or other intermediaries in jurisdictions that have weak laws and/or\ninadequate enforcement of laws in these areas.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They will seek to capitalise on\nthese weaknesses and use the intermediaries to distance themselves from the\nmoney laundering and other criminal schemes established on their behalf.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some offshore jurisdictions have been\nvulnerable to misuse in this way, TCSPs in onshore jurisdictions were at\nliberty to take advantage of these circumstances due to inadequate restrictions\non their operations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bearer shares are\nshares that can be readily moved from share holder to share holder without any\nrequirements for the recording of the ownership details with the company or any\ncompetent authority. Ownership of these shares vests in the person or entity\nthat has physical possession of the shares at any given time. This type of\nshare ownership affords anonymity to the shareholder who can freely obtain and\npass on these shares.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The unrestricted use of bearer shares not only prevents competent\nauthorities from being able to identify the legal or beneficial ownership of\ncorporate structures, but in tandem with inadequate AML/CFT (Anti-Money\nLaundering and Countering Financing of Terrorism)&nbsp;&nbsp; requirements for and oversight of TCSPs, it\nalso provides a veritable blank cheque for rogue TCSPs to design and operate\nmoney laundering schemes using corporate vehicles for the benefit of their\ncriminal clients.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shell companies have\nbeen&nbsp; by white-collar criminals in\nmoney-laundering operations, mutual-fund schemes, tax fraud and internal business\nfraud. To facilitate these types of schemes, shell companies may be used to\ngenerate false invoices, fictitious consultancy fees or bogus loans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where shell companies\nare permitted under the corporate registration laws of a jurisdiction or where\nits usage is unrestricted, this may present a money laundering and financial\ncrime vulnerability which criminals will take advantage of.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tackling the problem of\nanonymous shell companies is a crucial factor in combating a range of high\npriority international problems such as organised crime, tax evasion, corruption\nand money laundering.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shell companies\ntogether with other tools used in financial crimes, can be used in both the placement\nand layering phases of the money laundering process to disguise the trail of\nevidence.. shell companies have been used to establish layers between the\ncriminal and the laundering, fraudulent or corrupt transaction; and between the\npredicate crime and the criminal proceeds.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where jurisdictions allow their\nincorporation processes to be indiscriminately used in this way, TCSPs will\nhave no reason to self regulate to prevent criminals from taking advantage of\nthis facility.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money launderers and\nother criminalsl use TCSPs to take advantage of systems that allow for the\nestablishment of corporate structures with no apparent legitimate commercial\npurpose\u2026 TCSPs are increasingly involved in money laundering schemes.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Given the\ndiverse nature of activities of TCSPs within and across jurisdictions and the\ndiverse oversight regime governing these activities, it is difficult to\ndetermine whether the lack of money laundering cases in some jurisdictions is\ndue to the absence of abuses within those jurisdictions or the inability thus\nfar of regulatory and law enforcement authorities to detect such abuses.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nonetheless, the threat resulting from the potential role of TCSPs in\nfacilitating money laundering and terrorist financing constitutes a major\nconcern among jurisdictions where TCSP businesses are prevalent Although TCSPs\nare less conducive to the initial placement of criminally derived funds than for\nexample, banking institutions, they are prone to be used particularly in the\nlayering stage of money laundering. TCSPs possess many characteristics that\nmake them vulnerable to misuse for money laundering and terrorist financing\npurposes.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their fiduciary responsibility allow them often times to have\ndiscretionary control over the accounts and funds of their clients. Due to the\nbroad scope of their fiduciary responsibility, the risk exists that TCSPs may\nabuse this responsibility entrusted to them.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Furthermore, the ease\nwith which the sources and uses of funds as well as legal beneficial ownership information\ncan be concealed through the establishment of multiple accounts and the conduct\nof&nbsp; complex transactions on behalf of\nclients, constitutes another area of potential threat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TCSPs are used by criminals\nfor the entering or mediation of transactions from&nbsp; criminal activities-- their principals and/or\nemployees too have played&nbsp; important\nfacilitating roles in the money laundering process.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Structures created by\nTCSPs facilitate&nbsp; money launderers and\nterrorists, particularly at the layering stag There has to be a MANDATORY&nbsp; licensing regime for TCSPs.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/money-laundering-regulations-2017/money-laundering-regulations-2017\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/money-laundering-regulations-2017/money-laundering-regulations-2017</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TCSPs: prepare for and\ncarry out of transactions for a client concerning:---</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the forming of\ncompanies or other legal persons;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">acting or arranging for\nanother to act, as a director or secretary of a company, partner of a\npartnership or similar position in relation to other legal persons;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">providing a registered\noffice, business address, correspondence or administrative address or related\nservices for a company, partnership or any other legal person or arrangement;\nand<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">acting or arranging for\nanother person to act as a trustee of an express trust or similar legal\narrangement, or a nominee shareholder for a person, other than a listed\ncompany.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A money launderer may\nseek the service of a TCSP to set up legal structures or arrangements in\nmultiple jurisdictions.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jurisdictions that do not require identification of\nbeneficial owners; or that refuse to disclose such information when requested\nby competent authorities; or that do not have a robust regime of combating\nmoney laundering and terrorist financing, are jurisdictions often times of particular\ninterest to the money launderers and terrorists.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the legal entities or\nlegal arrangements are established, the money launderer or terrorist typically\nuses the companies or legal arrangements, by moving funds through the various\ncompany accounts, for money laundering or terrorist financing purposes.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money launderers are\nwell aware of the fact that investigation of a money laundering scheme is more\ncomplicated when there are more jurisdictions involved, since some\njurisdictions may be unable or unwilling to provide information on the legal\nentities or arrangements. As a result, the authorities investigating a\nparticular money laundering scheme will be unable to establish the link between\nthe funds and the criminal.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ease of formation\nof companies and legal arrangements in various jurisdictions, some of which\nhave a less robust oversight regime than others, make it also easier for money\nlaunderers to layer the proceeds of their criminal activities and integrate\nthem into the financial system.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Furthermore, advances\nin technology, financial engineering and innovation, have contributed significantly\nto the use of sophisticated legal structures and multiple accounts to\nfacilitate money laundering and terrorist financing. This has made it more\ndifficult to identify who is actually controlling the structures and accounts\nthereby contributing to a lack of transparency.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lawyers, accountants,\nnotaries and other such professionals provide services to clients to help them\nnavigate the often complex and sometimes treacherous world of finance, law and\ncorporate governance.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have essential knowledge and expertise in relation\nto the technical rules and regulations that pertain to the operation of\nbusiness, as well as experience in crafting legal strategies in relation to\ninvestment, mergers and acquisitions, tax liability, corporate structuring,\namong others.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These professionals can\nbe important service providers for businesses, high net worth investors and anyone\nwho has wealth or assets which need to be managed or channelled appropriately.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, these same skills and expertise are attributes that are desired by\ncriminals, who require assistance in organizing their affairs, to enable them\nto distance proceeds from their criminal origins; and to liberate these\nproceeds for eventual use in \u2018legitimate\u2019 endeavours.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For this purpose\ncriminals seek out the services of professional intermediaries to help them\nestablish corporate structures, set up trusts, transfer funds and negotiate\ndeals.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The important advantages to the criminal are: the concealment of the\nproceeds of crime; the granting of access to various financial centres through\nthe diverse mechanisms which can be used by these intermediaries; and the\ncreation of confusing audit trails to stymie law enforcement\u2019s efforts with\nregard to these transactions.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CDD information\ncomprises the facts about a customer that should enable an organisation to\nassess the extent to which the customer exposes it to a range of risks. These\nrisks include money laundering and terrorist financing.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organisations need to\n\u2018know their customers\u2019 for a number of reasons:-----</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">to comply with the\nrequirements of relevant legislation and regulation</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">to help the firm, at\nthe time the due diligence is carried out, to be reasonably certain that the\ncustomers are who they say they are, and that it is appropriate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">to provide them with\nthe products or services requested<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">to guard against fraud,\nincluding impersonation and identity fraud<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">to help the\norganisation to identify, during the course of a continuing relationship, what\nis unusual and to enable the unusual to be examined;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">if unusual events do\nnot have a commercial or otherwise straightforward rationale they may involve\nmoney laundering, fraud, or handling criminal or terrorist property<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">to enable the\norganisation to assist law enforcement, by providing available<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">information on\ncustomers being investigated following the making of a suspicion report to the\nFIU.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CDD ( customer due\ndiligence ) comprises of the following:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(a) Identifying the\ncustomer on the basis of documents, data or information obtained from a\nreliable and independent source;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(b) Identifying, where\napplicable, the beneficial owner and taking risk-based and adequate measures to\nunderstand the ownership and control structure of the customer;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(c) Obtaining\ninformation on the purpose and intended nature of the business relationship;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(d) Conducting ongoing\nmonitoring of the business relationship including ensuring that the\ntransactions being conducted are consistent with the knowledge of the customer,\nthe business and risk profile, including, where necessary, the source of funds\nand ensuring that documents, data or information held are kept up-to-date.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enhanced Customer Due\nDiligence (ECDD).--The extent of additional information sought, and of any\nmonitoring carried out in respect of any particular customer, will depend on\nthe money laundering or terrorist financing risk that the customer is assessed\nto present to the designated person.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The EU Third AML Directive\nprescribes three specific circumstances when ECDD measures must be applied:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(a) where the customer\nhas not been physically present for identification purposes;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(b) in respect of a\ncorrespondent banking relationship;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(c) in respect of a\nbusiness relationship or occasional transaction with a politically exposed\nperson (PEP).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">International standards\nrequire that a risk-based approach is applied to CDD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consequently, the\nmeasures should be applied on a risk-sensitive basis depending on the type of\ncustomer, business relationship or nature of the transactions or activity.\nHigher risk categories should be subject to enhanced due diligence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The risk assessment\nwill determine how much of the information collected needs to be independently\nverified, as the following examples indicate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only simplified or\nbasic account opening information may need to be collected for a low-balance,\nlow-turnover deposit account. The extent of information that is verified can be\nrestricted to the identification evidence and information concerning source of\nthe funds and the expected frequency of deposits and withdrawals.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For standard-risk\ncustomers, i.e. those who are permanently resident in the country, with a\nsalaried job or other transparent source of income, only the standard\ninformation provided may need to be verified.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enhanced due diligence\nshould be applied to higher-risk customers/clients. Enhanced due diligence must\nalso be applied to the beneficial owners or controllers of higher-risk\ncompanies or structures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quoted companies and\ntheir wholly-owned subsidiaries are considered to be lower-risk, requiring only\nsimplified due diligence. Privately owned companies and other entities, e.g.\ntrusts, are generally assessed as higher risk than quoted companies because they\nare exposed to a lower level of external scrutiny than those that are publicly\nowned.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For such relationships, the identities of the beneficial owners and\ncontrollers must also be verified in addition to verifying the identity of the\ncorporate entity. Beneficial owners may also be executive directors or the\nsettlors of trusts.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">IN INDIA WE TERM CDD AS\nKYC ( KNOW YOUR CUSTOMER )</b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Engaging in new\nbusiness relationships is risky, because of the ultimate question that has to\nbe addressed: \u2018Is this person or company really who they say they are?\u2019\nCustomer Due Diligence (CDD) or Know Your Customer (KYC) policies are the\ncornerstones of an effective AML/CTF program. Put simply, they are the act of\nperforming background checks on the customer to ensure that they are properly\nrisk assessed before being onboarded.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are three levels\nof CDD \u2013 \u2018Standard\u2019, \u2018Simplified\u2019, and \u2018Enhanced\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Standard due diligence<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018Standard due\ndiligence\u2019, as outlined above, should be applied to all clients, unless\n\u2018simplified\u2019 due diligence is or \u2018enhanced\u2019 due diligence is appropriate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Simplified due\ndiligence<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018Simplified due\ndiligence\u2019 means that you do not have to apply the standard due diligence\nbecause you believe that a client falls into a relevant category.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main categories are\ncredit or financial institutions subject to the provisions of the money\nlaundering directive or equivalent overseas requirements; companies listed on a\nregulated EEA market or equivalent overseas requirements subject to specified\ndisclosure obligations; and UK public authorities and certain public\nauthorities in the EU and EEA .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In such cases, it is important to ensure that\nthe person who is authorising the work is authorised to do so.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The circumstances in\nwhich \u2018simplified due diligence\u2019 can be applied are therefore quite limited,\nand even if it does, you must still carry out ongoing monitoring and\nappropriate KYC information should therefore still be obtained.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018Enhanced due\ndiligence\u2019 should be applied to clients in situations which present a higher risk\nof money laundering or terrorist financing, and in particular if a client has\nnot been physically present for identification purposes .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In such cases, one or\nmore additional measures must be taken to enhance due diligence, by either\ngathering additional documents, data or information, or taking additional steps\nto verify documents or obtain a confirmatory certificate from a credit or\nfinancial institution subject to the money laundering directive.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also, if you\nare dealing with a politically exposed person (PEP ), that is someone who has\nbeen entrusted with a prominent public function and presents a higher risk for\npotential involvement in bribery and corruption by virtue of their position and\nthe influence that they may hold, senior management must give approval for the\nrelationship to be established; you must take adequate measures to establish\nthe source of wealth and funds which are involved; and you must conduct\nenhanced monitoring once the relationship is established.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.fatf-gafi.org/media/fatf/documents/reports/RBA%20for%20TCSPs.pdf\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.fatf-gafi.org/media/fatf/documents/reports/RBA%20for%20TCSPs.pdf</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the creation of\ncomplex structures can often generate higher fees for TCSPs, this can<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">make such structures\nmore attractive to TCSPs thereby potentially reducing their ability to\nassociate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">an increased use of complex\nstructures with a higher money laundering risk.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The following are money\nlaundering indicators :-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Transactions that\nrequire the use of complex and opaque legal entities and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">arrangements;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The payment of\n\u201cconsultancy fees\u201d to shell companies established in foreign<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">jurisdictions or\njurisdictions known to have a market in the formation of numerous<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">shell companies;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The transfer of funds\nin the form of \u201cloans\u201d to individuals from trusts and non-bank<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">shell companies. These\nnon-traditional \u201cloans\u201d then facilitate a system of regular<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">transfers to these\ncorporate vehicles from the \u201cborrowing\u201d individuals in the form of<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cloan repayments\u201d;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Cases of corruption\nwhere the company paying the bribe to secure a contract or the<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">person brokering a\ncontract will seek to secure a successful outcome by utilising a<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TCSP to operate a trust\nwith the funds held on deposit for the benefit of the person<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">approving the contract;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The use of TCSPs in\njurisdictions that do not require TCSPs to capture, retain or<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">submit to competent\nauthorities information on the beneficial ownership of corporate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">structures formed by\nthem;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The use of legal\npersons and legal arrangements established in jurisdictions with weak<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">or absent AML/CFT laws\nand/or poor record of supervision and monitoring of<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TCSPs;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The use of legal\npersons or legal arrangements that operate in jurisdictions with<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">secrecy laws;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The use by\nprospective clients of nominee agreements to hide from the TCSP the<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">beneficial ownership of\nclient companies;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The carrying out of\nmultiple intercompany loan transactions and/or multijurisdictional<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">wire transfers that\nhave no apparent legal or commercial purpose;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Clients who require\nthe use of pre-constituted shell companies in jurisdictions that<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">allow their use but do\nnot require updating of ownership information; and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 TCSPs that market\nthemselves and/or their jurisdictions as facilitating anonymity and</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">disguised asset\nownership.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;More than \u00bc th the TCSPs do not ask for any\npurchaser identification. Besides acting as intermediaries, TCSPs offer various\nauxiliary services which range from establishing virtual facilities to filling\ncorporate roles as nominee directors, shareholders, to name a few .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In instances\nwhere information over ownership was displayed, the analyzed corporate vehicles\nwere created or governed by professional intermediaries, such as TCSPs and\ntrusts&nbsp; This shows that providers of\nfinancial, administrative and legal services can be employed to cover and\nfacilitate transactional schemes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The demand to erect webs of corporate\nvehicles and to allow third party members to legally own the assets of clients\ncan be explained by complexity. argues that the complexity of corporate\nstructures plays an important part in legitimizing financial transactions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For\ninstance, the second stage of money laundering (layering) is concerned with\nincreasing complexity usually by involving two or more jurisdictions as part of\nthe corporate structure .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ninvolvement of multiple jurisdictions further protects anonymity since strict\ncorporate and bank secrecy laws are enacted which prevent legal parties and\nfinancial institutions to disclose beneficial ownership information&nbsp; .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence, the more complex a corporate\nstructure is, the more challenging and costly it becomes to reconstruct a paper\ntrail. that no matter how complex the web is constructed, the possibility\nexists to track the ultimate beneficiary.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consequently, offshore jurisdictions,\nfinancial intermediaries and TCSPs are vulnerable to outside pressure and can\nreveal client identity documentation under the right circumstances.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\njurisdictions that provide the opportunity for individuals to mask their\nidentity behind corporate vehicles while constraining authorities from\nreceiving or exposing information on real ownership increases the vulnerability\nof misusage among corporate vehicles&nbsp; ,\nanonymity is guaranteed by the complexity of shell company structure and the\nsecrecy laws of offshore jurisdictions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence, high levels of complexity and\nbank secrecy laws in shell corporate structures create opportunities for the\nexistence of fraudulent activity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In order for an\ninvestigator to establish a link between a shell corporation and a third party\nin interest, the relationship between control and ownership needs to be\nunderstood. This knowledge is a prerequisite in order to attain insights into\nwho is involved in an illegal activity, who is in control and who ultimately\ngains.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To do so, legal ownership and beneficial ownership should be\ndifferentiated. The FATF defines beneficial owner (BO) as the\nactual person who exercises ultimate effective control over a legal body or an\narrangement, or the person on whose behalf transactions are conducted.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This has\nseveral noteworthy elements. Firstly, the BO can only be a natural person\nrather than a legal person. An asset owned by the latter \u2013 a corporation \u2013 is\nin itself always controlled by the latter \u2013 an actual person. Due to this, the\nlegal body can only refer to a corporate vehicle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secondly, beneficial\nownership implies a degree of control over an asset from which the BO derives\nutility.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Essentially, the BO may not always be on the scene, since it may\nappear that the assets in question belong to someone else. Hence, legal\nownership is irrelevant, whereas control is relevant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corporate laws, per se,\ndo not recognise beneficial ownership. This was the concept behind the\nintroduction of corporate veil and non-natural person.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nevertheless, in the\npost-2010 world, a U-turn has been taken and there is a potential desire with\nthe regulators to identify the beneficial owner of the corporate body not being\nthe ostensible owner.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The underlying reasons are anti-money laundering\nprovisions, application of insider trading and takeover regulations and benami\nlaw<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anonymous\ncompanies&nbsp; or shell companies, are\nentities that are used to disguise the identity of their true owner\u2014the person\n(or people) who ultimately control or profit from the company.&nbsp;&nbsp; These people are also known as the\n\u201cbeneficial owners\u201d.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anonymous companies often have very few or no employees at\nall, and most don\u2019t conduct any real business. They can be used to hide illegal\nbusinesses or to facilitate illegal activity, like tax evasion and Ponzi\nschemes that can rob billions from unsuspecting citizens.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Matters are made\nworse when another anonymous company is listed as an owner. The result mimics a\nspider web, branching out in tens or hundreds of different ways, creating a\nnearly indecipherable puzzle for investigators.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Hidden company ownership is a\nbig contributor to the trillions&nbsp; that\nleaves developing countries illicitly every year. It allows tax evaders,\ncriminals, and corrupt officials to move money undetected, often into banks in\nthe U.S. and Europe.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This outflow of cash deprives developing country economies\nof much needed capital while denying governments of tax revenue, threatening to\nwipe out any potential benefit gained from foreign investment. Although\nbillions of dollars of foreign investment and development aid flow in every\nyear, almost double that amount moves out by way of illicit financial flows.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Legal owners of a company can be another company, a nominee director or proxy\nsuch as a lawyer who forms the company on somebody else\u2019s behalf as the Panama\nPapers illustrate. Beneficial ownership refers to the beneficial owner of the\nshares of a private company, as opposed to the legal owner of shares of a\ncompany, namely the de jure versus de facto ownership of shares.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beneficial owner is a\nlegal term where specific property rights (\"use and title\") in equity\nbelong to a person even though legal title of the property belongs to another\nperson.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This often relates where the legal title owner has implied trustee\nduties to the beneficial owner. This often relates where the legal title owner\nhas implied trustee duties to the beneficial owner.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beneficial ownership is a\nterm used in international commercial legislation referred to anyone who enjoys\nthe benefits of ownership of a security or property, and yet does not nominally\nown the asset itself<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A beneficial owner (as\ndistinct from a \"nominee owner,\" \"registered owner,\" or\n\"record holder\") of a security includes any person who, directly or\nindirectly, has or shares voting or investment power.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\nFinancial Action Task Force on Money Laundering (FATF), an independent\ninter-governmental body that develops and promotes policies to protect the\nglobal financial system against money laundering and terrorist financing, the\nterm beneficial owner refers to the natural person(s) who ultimately owns or\ncontrols a legal entity and/or the natural person on whose behalf a transaction\nis being conducted.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It also includes those persons who exercise ultimate\neffective control over a legal person or arrangement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The terms \u2018ultimately\nowns or controls\u2019 and \u2018ultimate effective control\u2019 refer to situations in which\nownership/control is exercised through a chain of ownership or by means of\ncontrol other than direct control. The FATF Recommendations are recognised as\nthe global anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorist financing (CFT)\nstandard.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To be technical,\nbeneficial ownership is a common law concept used to distinguish rights held by\npersons with a beneficial interest in property from those who hold those\ninterests legally (i.e., in name only).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the case of shares, a person can\nhold shares legally (in their name) or beneficially (as a nominee shareholder \u2013\nmeaning for the benefit of another person). The legal owner of property is\nregistered at the Land Registry on the title deeds.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;They will also be stated\nwithin the mortgage offer as mortgage lenders require all legal owners to be\njointly and severally liable for the mortgage. You can have a maximum of 4\nlegal owners registered on the title and they have control over when the\nproperty is sold or transferred. Legal owners are also known as nominees or\nregistered owners.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beneficial ownership is \"an interest in the economic\nbenefit of property\". Your beneficial ownership in property reflects your\nshare of any gain/loss from the property including rent and profit/loss on\nsale. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The legal owner of the\nproperty (trustee) has the right to possession, the privilege of use, and the\npower to convey those rights and privileges. The trustee thus appears by all\ncounts to be the owner of the property\u2014or so it appears to all but one person, the\nbeneficial owner (beneficiary, cestui que trust).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As between the trustee and\nthe beneficiary, the beneficiary gets all the benefits of the property. The\ntrustee has a fiduciary duty to the beneficial owner to exercise his legal\nrights, privileges, and powers in such a way as to benefit not himself but the\nbeneficiary.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the trustee fails to do this, the courts will require him to\npay over what he has earned for himself to the beneficiary and may, in extreme\ncases, remove him as legal owner and substitute another in his stead. Trust\ninstruments can be quite complicated. They may provide for succession among the\ntrustees and for succession among the beneficiaries.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They may give the trustee\nconsiderable discretion in managing the property and in paying out the benefits\nto the beneficiaries. In nearly all jurisdictions the beneficiary\u2019s interest\nmay be insulated from the claims of his creditors, as in a spendthrift, or\nprotective, trust.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes, the term\nLegal Owner&nbsp; describes a person who holds\nlegal title to property for someone else's benefit.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Divisions between legal\nand beneficial ownership are normally created by an express instrument of\ntrust.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When there are joint\nlegal owners, they hold the property on trust for each other; either as tenants\nin common (separate shares) or as joint tenants (owned 100% between a maximum\nof 2 legal owners - normally married couples or civil partners).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The beneficial\ninterest for the latter is simple, the married couples own 100% of the\nbeneficial ownership so any gain or loss from the property is 100% theirs\njointly (shared 50/50 on their tax return). The beneficial owner of property is\nthe real owner of property, even though it is in someone else\u2019s name.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\ntransfer of an equitable estate or interest in land or a transaction that\nresults in a change in the beneficial ownership of land attracts duty at the\nsame rates as a transfer of full legal title to land. Organisation for Economic\nCooperation and Development (OECD), has once again emphasised the need for\nbeneficial ownership and corporate transparency&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India has introduced\nlegislation on beneficial ownership in the Companies (Amendment) Bill, 2016\nwhich is currently being reviewed by the Parliamentary Standing Committee on\nFinance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An anonymous company is an entity used to disguise the identity of\ntheir true human owner \u2014 the person(s) who ultimately control or profit from\nthe company, or its \u2018beneficial owners\u2019. Anonymous companies often have very\nfew or no employees at all, most don\u2019t conduct any real business but are\nlegally eligible to make financial transactions, buy a million-dollar penthouse\nor own other companies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, it is close to impossible to trace the\ntransactions carried out by these companies to the people who actually own or\nbenefit from them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Financial secrecy that\ncan be afforded by powerful multi-national corporations and rich individuals\nends up hurting the poor by eroding tax revenues for countries.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Anonymous\ncompanies are also behind crime and corruption \u2013 the likes of terrorist\nfinancing, human traffickers, drug cartels and mobsters.&nbsp; Almost every economic crime involves the\nmisuse of corporate vehicles.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Onshore or offshore \u2013 unaccounted for wealth,\nassets and income hurt every country\u2019s economy. India must take world\nleadership and legislates in favour of public beneficial ownership registries\nin the&nbsp; Parliament, in order to clamp\ndown on the shadow economy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Significant Beneficial\nOwner' has been defined to refer to \"every individual, who acting alone or\ntogether, or through one or more persons or trust, including a trust and\npersons resident outside India, holds beneficial interests, of not less than\ntwenty-five per cent or such other percentage as may be prescribed, in shares\nof a company or the right to exercise, or the actual exercising of significant\ninfluence or control <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
