Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/10/tipu-sultan-unmasked-capt-ajit.html?showComment=1483090758693#c6807941065157438990\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 30, 2016 at 3:09 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_178MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED TO 2-<br />\n<br />\nQUEEN VICTORIA WAS A DRUG RUNNER-- AN AGENT OF JEW ROTHSCHILD<br />\n<br />\nJEW Rothschild forced Indian farmers to stop farming food and turn to growing opium poppies. A lot of destitute families landed up as SLAVES abroad ( indentured labour )<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTHE RICHEST MEN IN USA ARE DESCENDANTS OF OPIUM DRUG RUNNERS --AGENTS OF JEW ROTHSCHILD<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/dirty-secrets-of-boston-tea-party-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nThe entire DRUG trade and SLAVE trade was controlled by Rothschild and his Jewish agents . Today if you write this it becomes HATE SPEECH and DEFAMATION .<br />\n<br />\nThe SLAVE British monarchy( to Jew Rothschild ) honored them with privilege ( earls/ dukes/ lords ) and knighthood .<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /><span style=\"color: blue;\">After the British established Hong Kong as a colony in the aftermath of the Opium Wars, local merchants felt the need for a bank to finance the growing opium trade with China, so they established (by special permit from the British) the </span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation - HSBC </span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\">today - \"The World's Bank\".</span></span><br />\n<br />\nThe huge textile mills in Bombay that paid true slave wages were all owned by Jew Rothschild and Sassoon with Indians as mere fronts<br />\n<br />\nADI GODREJ THE ONER OF VIKROLI WHO RIDICULED \"HINDU RATE OF GROWTH\" KNOWS SHIT ABOUT HIS OWN ANCESTORS.<br />\n<br />\nEdward Albert. Sassoon married Aline Caroline de Rothschild in 1887<br />\n<br />\nJEW Roosevelt's fortune was inherited from his maternal grandfather JEW Warren Delano<br />\n<br />\nMAJJA HAI--KISSI KOH KUCH NAHIN PATHA<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_179b+seedFLCnD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_179b+seedFLCnD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sophisticated criminal\noperations often use trade-based money laundering, which can also involve trade\nmisinvoicing, to move large quantities of illicit money between countries. By co-mingling\nthe proceeds of crime with the proceeds of legitimate business, launderers are\nable to disguise the ultimate source of the illicit money.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, in the\nLebanese-Canadian Bank case, an international drug money laundering operation\nwith ties to Hezbollah commingled the revenues from used car sales in Europe\nwith cocaine sales in Africa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Global Organization\nof Parliamentarians Against Corruption -GOPAC is an independent international\ninstitution made up of democratically elected legislators from across the\nworld, working together to combat corruption, strengthen good government, and\nuphold the rule of law.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Based in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, GOPAC has fifty-two\nnational chapters in five continental associations. GOPAC supports its members\nthrough original research, global anti</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;ms mincho&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2011</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">corruption\ncapacity building, and international peer support.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GOPAC seeks to achieve\nethical and accountable governance throughout the world, through effective\nanti-corruption mechanisms and co-operation between parliamentarians,\ngovernment leaders, and civil society. India is a member<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GOPAC ('Global Order of\nParliamentarians Against Corruption') recognises that regimes that lack systems\nof accountability and transparency typically allow for high levels of money\nlaundering and corruption. Some of the poorest countries in the world are the\nmost corrupt, as measured by Transparency International's Global Corruption\nReport.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are areas of the\nworld which specialise in non-disclosure, that is they have local laws which\ncreate the systems whereby the true ownership of assets can, quite legitimately\nremain concealed behind shell companies or in protected trusts fronted by\nlawyers who claim client confidentiality when questioned.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here rich people\nsquirrel away assets from the taxman, vengeful ex \u2013 spouses or regulatory\nauthorities behind legal walls which are almost impossible to penetrate even at\ngovernment level.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money laundering is big business. Textbooks often describe\nthe average money launderer either as criminals washing illegal proceeds of\ncrime by setting up fake restaurants or smuggling the money in suitcases out to\nthe Channel Islands, or sometimes as former officials of corrupt regimes buying\nluxury properties in London but, in fact, it is a global phenomenon on a far\nwider scale involving some very scary organisations indeed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Global Financial\nIntegrity (GFI) is a non-profit, research, advisory, and advocacy organization\nlocated in Washington, D.C.. GFI produces research on the scale, impact, and\nattributes of illicit financial flows\u2014the proceeds of crime, corruption, and\ntax evasion\u2014with a particular focus on developing and emerging economies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Staffed with a team of economists, lawyers, and policy analysts, the\norganization also advises developing country governments on policy solutions to\ncurtail those flows, and promotes transparency measures in the international\nfinancial system as a means to global development and security.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Global Financial\nIntegrity's areas of research apply primarily to stemming illicit financial\nflows, an illegal form of capital flight. GFI argues that illicit financial\nflows make poverty endemic; for every $1 poor nations receive in foreign aid,\n$10 in dirty money is taken abroad illicitly.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lack of controls on illicit\noutflows enable drug cartels, terrorist organizations and tax evaders to\nsecretly move money around the world. The billions of dollars taken out of the\nthird world embeds poverty, strips developing nations of critical resources,\nand contributes to failed states.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Global Financial Integrity periodically\nreleases updated reports estimating illicit financial flows, the proceeds of\ncrime, corruption, and tax evasion, from all developing countries. In 2010, GFI\nreleased a report detailing offshore secrecy accounts held by non-residents.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The report found that the total deposits by non-residents in offshore centers\nand secrecy jurisdictions was nearly $10 trillion;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The United States, the\nUnited Kingdom, and the Cayman Islands were found to be the top destinations\nfor offshore money.. GFI's 2010 India Report found that between 1948 and 2008,\nIndia lost $213 billion to illicit financial flows, and that the present value\nof India\u2019s illicit financial flows is $462 billion.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Most of the illicit\nfinancial flows were found to have come from High Net-Worth Individuals and\nprivate companies, as well as India's large underground economy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition,\nthe Indian private sector was found to have shifted to offshore financial\ncenters, up to 54.2% in 2009 from 36.4% in 1995. The report was widely cited in\nthe international press following the start of the 2011 Indian anti-corruption\nmovement as a way to measure the amount of black money held abroad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Global Financial\nIntegrity (GFI) has pushed for policies that bring transparency to the\ninternational financial system and stem illicit financial flows.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\norganizations has urged the Organization for Economic Cooperation and\nDevelopment (OECD) and the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) to implement new\nsafeguards that will greatly improve transparency and cooperation in the global\nfinancial system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In early 2010, GFI launched the \u201cG20 Transparency Campaign\u201d,\ncalling for greater transparency in the global financial system.[16]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GFI endorses stronger\nanti-money laundering laws and standards as well as stronger implementation of\nexisting anti-money laundering laws and regulations. The organization\nspecifically supports countries making all felonies predicate offenses for\nmoney laundering, it recommends compliance with all FATF standards, and it\nencourages regulators to strongly enforce all existing laws and\nregulations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GFI was fiercely\ncritical of the United States Government in the wake of recent anti-money\nlaundering settlements with major banks such as HSBC, Standard Chartered, and\nWachovia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GFI has supported the\nCombating Money Laundering, Terrorist Financing and Counterfeiting Act as well\nas the Holding Individuals Accountable and Deterring Money Laundering Act in\nthe United States Congress as measures to help curtail money laundering.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GFI advocates against\nthe abuse of anonymous companies as a tool for money laundering. The\norganization endorses the creation of public registers of beneficial ownership\ninformation, and it has supported efforts by the British Government and the\nEuropean Parliament to do just that.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the United States,\nGFI advocates in favor of the bipartisan Incorporation Transparency and Law\nEnforcement Assistance Act, which would ban anonymous companies in the United\nStates by creating beneficial ownership registries available to law\nenforcement.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the legislation does not require that the collected\ninformation be made available to the public, it leaves the possibility for the\nstates to make the information public.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Proposed measures\nsupported by GFI include \"requiring companies to report on the profits\nmade and taxes paid in every country in which they operate\"\n(Country-by-Country reporting) and implementing the automatic exchange of tax\ninformation between jurisdictions. GFI also called upon the G20 to take action to\nencourage and implement the automatic exchange of tax information, which the\nG20 then endorsed in 2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GFI has additionally\nsupported the bipartisan Stop Tax Haven Abuse Act, introduced by Senator Carl\nLevin. The bill would mandate Country-by-Country reporting for all companies\nregistered with the SEC, a longtime goal of GFI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Task Force has 5\nmain policy goals:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Curtailment of\nmispricing in trade imports and exports;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Country-by-country\naccounting of sales, profits, and taxes paid by multinational corporations;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Confirmation of\nbeneficial ownership in all banking and securities accounts;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Automatic cross-border\nexchange of tax information on personal and business accounts;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Harmonization of\npredicate offenses under anti-money laundering laws across all Financial Action\nTask Force cooperating countries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of GFI\u2019s policy\nrecommendations, such as eliminating anonymous shell companies and tackling\ntrade misinvoicing, will have the effect of making it more difficult to launder\nmoney, which means they make it more difficult for criminals to actually use\ntheir money without being caught.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In addition to those, GFI has several other\npolicy recommendations to address money laundering<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Make all felonies\npredicate offenses for money laundering. In many countries, certain key crimes\nsuch as tax evasion cannot be the basis for a money laundering charge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Countries should comply\nwith all FATF standards. According to a 2013 OECD report, many FATF countries\nare poorly compliant on key standards designed to prevent money laundering.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Financial Action\nTask Force (FATF) exists for the purpose of protecting the international\nfinancial system from misuse and to mobilise action to go after criminals and\ntheir assets.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Objectives of the FATF\nin developing policy and promoting effective implementation of legal,\nregulatory and operational measures for combating money laundering, terrorist\nfinancing and new and emerging threats to the integrity of the international\nfinancial system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The FATF members have\nadopted revised standards in February 2012.&nbsp;\nNow these changes are well reflected in the new international standard.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bankers who knowingly\ncommit crimes and allow bank accounts to be used to shelter criminal money\nshould be held personally accountable. To date, enforcement has generally\nfocused on moderate-sized fines and promises by banks to improve compliance. No\nbank should be \u201ctoo big to jail.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India became a member\nof the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) in 2010. The membership of FATF comes\nnearly four years after the country became an observer in 2006.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FATF membership is very\nimportant for India in its quest to become a major player in international\nfinance. It will help India to build the capacity to fight terrorism and trace\nterrorist money and help to successfully investigate and prosecute money\nlaundering and terrorist financing offences.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India will benefit in securing a\nmore transparent and stable financial system by ensuring that financial\ninstitutions are not vulnerable to infiltration or abuse by organized crime\ngroups.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many national\nlevel efforts to combat money laundering. Financial Intelligence Unit - India\n(FIU-IND) is the central, national agency responsible for receiving,\nprocessing, analyzing and disseminating information relating to suspect\nfinancial transactions to enforcement agencies and foreign FIUs.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://www.dailypioneer.com/nation/swamy-exposes-pcs-hidden-assets-abroad.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;http://www.dailypioneer.com/nation/swamy-exposes-pcs-hidden-assets-abroad.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">LIKE HOW DONALD TRUMP IS SYSTEMATICALLY REMOVING ALL OBAMA LOYALISTS</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">WE ASK MODI TO REMOVE ALL LOYALISTS OF THE ITALIAN WAITRESS FROM FINANCIAL WATCH DOG AGENCIES</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\"><a href=\"http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/EDs-Rs-2030-crore-notice-to-NDTV-for-Fema-breach/articleshow/49877029.cms\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/EDs-Rs-2030-crore-notice-to-NDTV-for-Fema-breach/articleshow/49877029.cms</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<o:p><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\"><a href=\"http://www.moneylife.in/article/delhi-hc-vacates-itat-stay-on-rs525-crore-penalty-on-ndtv/49995.html\">http://www.moneylife.in/article/delhi-hc-vacates-itat-stay-on-rs525-crore-penalty-on-ndtv/49995.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The beginning of the\n21st century is marked by the fall of a huge corporations&nbsp; like&nbsp;\nEnron which caused investors to lose faith in the stock market\u2019s ability\nto deliver long-term growth .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Due to this, much emphasis has been placed on the\nimportance of financial information transparency and the restructuring of international\nfinancial reporting standards (IFRS) .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence, corporations were pushed to\nestablish better internal controls, increased management responsibility, and\nlower information asymmetry.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This led to\nthe introduction of the Sarbanes-Oxley act in the U.S. and the adaptation of\nIFRS by the E.U. in 2002.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sarbanes-Oxley Act\nof 2002 (SOX) is an act passed by U.S. Congress in 2002 to protect investors\nfrom the possibility of fraudulent accounting activities by corporations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nSOX Act mandated strict reforms to improve financial disclosures from\ncorporations and prevent accounting fraud.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The SOX Act was created in response\nto accounting malpractice in the early 2000s, when public scandals such as\nEnron Corporation shook investor confidence in financial statements and\ndemanded an overhaul of regulatory standards.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The act, drafted by U.S.\nCongressmen Paul Sarbanes and Michael Oxley, was aimed at improving corporate\ngovernance and accountability. Now, all public companies must comply with SOX\nin USA. The Sarbanes-Oxley Act not only affects the financial side of\ncorporations, but also IT departments charged with storing a corporation's\nelectronic records.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The act is not a set of business practices and does not\nspecify how a business should store records; rather, it defines which records\nshould be stored and for how long. SOX states that all business records,\nincluding electronic records and electronic messages, must be saved for\n\"not less than five years.\"</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The consequences for noncompliance are\nfines, imprisonment or both. IT departments are increasingly tasked with\ncreating and maintaining a corporate records archive in a cost-effective\nfashion that satisfies the requirements put forth by the legislation.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Section\n802 of Sarbanes-Oxley contains the three rules that affect the management of\nelectronic records. The first rule deals with the destruction, alteration or\nfalsification of records, and the resulting penalties. The second rule defines\nthe retention period for records storage.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Best practices indicate that corporations\nsecurely store all business records using the same guidelines set for public\naccountants. The third rule refers to the type of business records that need to\nbe stored, including all business records and communications, including\nelectronic communications<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The intent of the SOX\nAct was to protect investors by improving the accuracy and reliability of\ncorporate disclosures by:-</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">closing loopholes in\nrecent accounting practices<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">strengthening corporate\ngovernance rules<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">increasing\naccountability and disclosure requirements of corporations, especially\ncorporate executives, and corporation's public accountants<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">increasing requirements\nfor corporate transparency in reporting to shareholders and descriptions of\nfinancial transactions<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">strengthening\nwhistle-blower protections and compliance monitoring<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">increasing penalties\nfor corporate and executive malfeasance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">authorizes the creation\nof the Public Company Accounting Oversight board to further monitor corporate\nbehavior, especially in the area of accounting<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In response to what was\nwidely seen as collusion by Enron's accountants, The Arthur Andersen firm, in\nEnron's fraudulent behavior, SOX also changes the way corporate boards deal\nwith their financial auditors.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All companies, according to SOX, must provide a\nyear-end, report about the internal controls they have in place and the\neffectiveness of those internal controls. The best plan of action for SOX\ncompliance is to have the correct security controls in place to ensure that financial\ndata is accurate and protected against loss.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Developing best practices and\nrelying on the appropriate tools helps businesses automate SOX compliance and\nreduce SOX management costs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The Securities and Exchange Board of India, or\nSEBI, which regulates India\u2019s stock markets, took a major step in this\ndirection a year ago. It asked Indian firms above a certain size to implement\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">Clause 49</span></b>, a regulation that strengthens the role of independent directors\nserving on corporate boards.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India, the SEBI monitors and regulates\ncorporate governance of listed companies through Cl. 49 of the Listing\nAgreement. Cl. 49 of the Listing Agreement is influenced by the Sarbanes-Oxley\nAct of 2002 which has been enacted in US..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Clause 49 has prescribed certain\nduties for independent directors under which that they are supposed to review\ncompany efforts whether they are in compliance with all applicable laws and\nlaying down a general code of conduct.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another crucial issue in relation to\nindependent directors in India is that the majority of shareholders appoint\nindependent directors. Noticeable, in India, most of the huge corporation\u2019s\nshareholders are either individuals or family members. Further, the major fall\nback and serious threats to transparency and accountability comes because India\ncompanies are mostly family dominated.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, the major stakeholders in\nmost of these enterprises are family members who do not find it compelling to\nreveal sufficient information to the independent directors. Therefore for\nindependent directors, to keep a check on the accountability and transparency\nbecomes an arduous task especially because they attended very few meetings per\nyear&nbsp; that are to a large extent\nceremonial in nature.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence it is not possible for independent directors to fully\ncomprehend the issues before the board, as most of the large business\nstructures are often conglomerates having diverse interests and investments....<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Independent Directors\nplays a significant role in good corporate governance. There is a huge scope of\nimprovement in the role, power and selection of Independent Directors in Indian\nCompanies.&nbsp; The objectives of corporate\ngovernance cannot, perhaps, be as effectively met without the inclusion of\nindependent directors in the larger scheme of things....<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under Clause 49 SEBI\nshould also come as a reminder to directors that they are fiduciaries towards\nthe shareholders, hence there should be continuous efforts being made to make\nthem more accountable. The inclusion of independent directors is a check&nbsp; on the management of companies as an\noversight mechanism. .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/hNwPD0I5Tms/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hNwPD0I5Tms?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">May be director of hajaaar companies , SUHEL SETH\nwho loves British&nbsp; invasions can explain\nbetter.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238);
